 27460                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>
 27461                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27462                                  ;
 27463                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 27464                                  ;
 27465                                  ; Inputs:
 27466                                  ;       BX = Physical cluster
 27467                                  ;       CX = No. of records
 27468                                  ;       DL = sector within cluster
 27469                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27470                                  ;       [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 27471                                  ; Outputs:
 27472                                  ;       AX = No. of records remaining
 27473                                  ;       BX = Transfer address
 27474                                  ;       CX = No. or records to be transferred
 27475                                  ;       DX = Physical sector address            (LOW)
 27476                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] = Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27477                                  ;       DI = Next cluster
 27478                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Last cluster accessed
 27479                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 27480                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27481                                  ; ES:BP unchanged. Note that segment of transfer not set.
 27482                                  ;
 27483                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27484                                  
 27485                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27486                                  OPTIMIZE:
 27487 00004E45 52                      	PUSH    DX
 27488 00004E46 53                              PUSH    BX
 27489                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 27490 00004E47 268A4604                        MOV     AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 27491 00004E4B FEC0                            INC     AL              ; Number of sectors per cluster
 27492 00004E4D 88C4                            MOV     AH,AL
 27493 00004E4F 28D0                            SUB     AL,DL           ; AL = Number of sectors left in first cluster
 27494 00004E51 89CA                            MOV     DX,CX
 27495                                  	;MOV	CX,0
 27496                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27497                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27498 00004E53 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; sub cx,cx
 27499                                  OPTCLUS:
 27500                                  ; AL has number of sectors available in current cluster
 27501                                  ; AH has number of sectors available in next cluster
 27502                                  ; BX has current physical cluster
 27503                                  ; CX has number of sequential sectors found so far
 27504                                  ; DX has number of sectors left to transfer
 27505                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 27506                                  ; ES:SI has FAT pointer
 27507                                  
 27508                                  do_norm3:
 27509 00004E55 E8A807                          call	UNPACK
 27510 00004E58 7237                            JC	short OP_ERR
 27511                                  clusgot2:
 27512 00004E5A 00C1                    	ADD	CL,AL
 27513 00004E5C 80D500                          ADC     CH,0
 27514 00004E5F 39D1                            CMP     CX,DX
 27515 00004E61 7333                            JAE	short BLKDON
 27516 00004E63 88E0                            MOV     AL,AH
 27517 00004E65 43                              INC     BX
 27518 00004E66 39DF                            CMP     DI,BX
 27519 00004E68 74EB                            JZ	short OPTCLUS
 27520 00004E6A 4B                              DEC     BX
 27521                                  FINCLUS:
 27522 00004E6B 891E[BC05]                      MOV     [CLUSNUM],BX    ; Last cluster accessed
 27523 00004E6F 29CA                            SUB     DX,CX           ; Number of sectors still needed
 27524 00004E71 52                              PUSH    DX
 27525 00004E72 89C8                            MOV     AX,CX
 27526                                  	;mul	word[ES:BP+2]
 27527 00004E74 26F76602                        MUL	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] 
 27528                                  				; Number of sectors times sector size
 27529 00004E78 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 27530 00004E7C 01F0                            ADD     AX,SI           ; Adjust by size of transfer
 27531 00004E7E A3[B805]                        MOV     [NEXTADD],AX
 27532 00004E81 58                              POP     AX              ; Number of sectors still needed
 27533 00004E82 5A                              POP     DX              ; Starting cluster
 27534 00004E83 29D3                            SUB     BX,DX           ; Number of new clusters accessed
 27535 00004E85 011E[BA05]                      ADD     [LASTPOS],BX
 27536 00004E89 5B                              POP     BX              ; BL = sector position within cluster
 27537 00004E8A E81700                  	call	FIGREC
 27538 00004E8D 89F3                            MOV     BX,SI
 27539 00004E8F F8                      	CLC
 27540 00004E90 C3                              retn
 27541                                  OP_ERR:
 27542 00004E91 83C404                          ADD     SP,4
 27543 00004E94 F9                      	STC
 27544 00004E95 C3                              retn
 27545                                  BLKDON:
 27546 00004E96 29D1                            SUB     CX,DX           ; Number of sectors in cluster we don't want
 27547 00004E98 28CC                            SUB     AH,CL           ; Number of sectors in cluster we accepted
 27548 00004E9A FECC                            DEC     AH              ; Adjust to mean position within cluster
 27549 00004E9C 8826[7305]                      MOV     [SECCLUSPOS],AH
 27550 00004EA0 89D1                            MOV     CX,DX           ; Anyway, make the total equal to the request
 27551 00004EA2 EBC7                            JMP     SHORT FINCLUS
 27552                                  
 27553                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 27554                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27555                                  ;
 27556                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 27557                                  ;
 27558                                  ; Inputs:
 27559                                  ;       DX = Physical cluster number
 27560                                  ;       BL = Sector position within cluster
 27561                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27562                                  ; Outputs:
 27563                                  ;       DX = physical sector number           (LOW)
 27564                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27565                                  ; No other registers affected.
 27566                                  ;
 27567                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27568                                  
 27569                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27570                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27571                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27572                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27573                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 27574                                  FIGREC:
 27575 00004EA4 51                              PUSH    CX
 27576                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27577 00004EA5 268A4E05                        MOV     CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27578 00004EA9 4A                              DEC     DX
 27579 00004EAA 4A                              DEC     DX
 27580                                  
 27581                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 27582                                  	;SHL	DX,CL
 27583                                  
 27584                                  ;hkn; SS override HIGH_SECTOR
 27585                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27586 00004EAB 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27587 00004EB2 08C9                    	OR	CL,CL				;F.C. >32mb
 27588 00004EB4 740C                    	JZ	short noshift			;F.C. >32mb
 27589 00004EB6 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH 				;F.C. >32mb
 27590                                  rotleft:					;F.C. >32mb
 27591 00004EB8 F8                      	CLC					;F.C. >32mb
 27592 00004EB9 D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1				;F.C. >32mb
 27593                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27594 00004EBB 36D116[0706]            	RCL	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],1		;F.C. >32mb
 27595 00004EC0 E2F6                    	LOOP	rotleft				;F.C. >32mb
 27596                                  noshift:
 27597                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27598 00004EC2 08DA                            OR      DL,BL
 27599                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+0Bh]
 27600 00004EC4 2603560B                        ADD     DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 27601                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27602                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27603 00004EC8 368316[0706]00                  ADC	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27604                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0        
 27605 00004ECE 59                      	POP     CX
 27606                                  figrec_retn:
 27607 00004ECF C3                              retn
 27608                                  
 27609                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27610                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27611                                  
 27612                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27613                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 27614                                  
 27615                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 27616                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27617                                  ;
 27618                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 27619                                  ;
 27620                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 27621                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 27622                                  ;
 27623                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 27624                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 27625                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 27626                                  ;
 27627                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 27628                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 27629                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 27630                                  ;
 27631                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 27632                                  ;
 27633                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 27634                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 27635                                  ;           ELSE
 27636                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 27637                                  ;
 27638                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 27639                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 27640                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 27641                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 27642                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 27643                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 27644                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 27645                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 27646                                  ;   allocated.
 27647                                  ;
 27648                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 27649                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 27650                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 27651                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 27652                                  ;
 27653                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27654                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27655                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27656                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 27657                                  ;   explanation:
 27658                                  ;
 27659                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 27660                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 27661                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 27662                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 27663                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 27664                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 27665                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 27666                                  ;   the
 27667                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 27668                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 27669                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 27670                                  ;
 27671                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 27672                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 27673                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 27674                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 27675                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 27676                                  ;
 27677                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27678                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27679                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27680                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 27681                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 27682                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27683                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 27684                                  ;
 27685                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 27686                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 27687                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 27688                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 27689                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 27690                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 27691                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 27692                                  ;
 27693                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 27694                                  
 27695                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 27696                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 27697                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 27698                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 27699                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 27700                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 27701                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 27702                                  ;callmagic  endp
 27703                                  
 27704                                  ALLOCATE:
 27705                                  	; 10/09/2018
 27706                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27707                                  ;
 27708                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 27709                                  ;
 27710                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 27711                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 27712                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 27713                                  ;data would not.
 27714                                  ;        
 27715                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 27716                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 27717                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 27718                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 27719                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 27720                                  
 27721                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27722                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 27723                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 27724                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 27725                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 27726                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 27727                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 27728                                  
 27729                                  ;Regular_Allocate_Path:
 27730                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27731                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27732                                  
 27733                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27734                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27735                                  
 27736 00004ED0 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 27737 00004ED1 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27738 00004ED3 E82A07                  	call	UNPACK
 27739 00004ED6 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 27740 00004EDA 5B                              POP     BX
 27741 00004EDB 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 27742                                  
 27743 00004EDD 51                              PUSH    CX
 27744 00004EDE 53                              PUSH    BX
 27745                                  
 27746 00004EDF 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 27747                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 27748                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 27749 00004EE1 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 27750 00004EE5 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 27751 00004EE8 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 27752                                  
 27753                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 27754                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 27755                                  
 27756                                  ads1:
 27757                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27758                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27759 00004EEA 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27760 00004EF0 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 27761                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 27762                                  
 27763                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 27764                                  ;
 27765                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 27766                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27767                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27768                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 27769                                  
 27770                                  FINDFRE:
 27771 00004EF3 43                              INC     BX
 27772                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 27773 00004EF4 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 27774 00004EF8 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 27775 00004EFA E80307                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 27776 00004EFD 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27777 00004EFF 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 27778                                  
 27779                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 27780                                  ;
 27781                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 27782                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27783                                  
 27784                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 27785                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27786 00004F01 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 27787 00004F05 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 27788 00004F06 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 27789 00004F09 E84807                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 27790 00004F0C 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27791                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 27792                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27793 00004F0E 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27794 00004F13 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 27795                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 27796                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 27797 00004F15 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 27798                                  NO_ALLOC:
 27799 00004F19 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 27800 00004F1A 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 27801 00004F1C 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 27802 00004F1E E83307                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 27803                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 27804                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 27805 00004F21 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 27806 00004F23 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 27807 00004F24 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 27808 00004F26 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 27809                                  
 27810                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 27811                                  ;
 27812                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 27813                                  
 27814 00004F28 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27815 00004F2B E82607                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 27816                                  
 27817                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 27818                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 27819                                  ;
 27820                                  ;       'C' set if error
 27821                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 27822                                  
 27823                                  ads4:   
 27824 00004F2E 5B                      	POP     BX
 27825 00004F2F 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 27826 00004F30 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27827 00004F32 E8CB06                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 27828                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 27829 00004F35 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27830 00004F37 E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 27831 00004F3A 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27832 00004F3C 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 27833 00004F3E 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 27834 00004F40 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 27835                                  
 27836                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 27837                                  ;   info
 27838                                  dofastk:
 27839                                  	; 20/05/2019
 27840                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27841                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27842                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 27843                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 27844                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27845                                  
 27846                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27847                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27848                                  	
 27849                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27850                                  	;push	dx ; *
 27851                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 27852                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27853                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27854                                  	
 27855                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27856 00004F42 06                      	PUSH	ES
 27857 00004F43 C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 27858                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 27859 00004F47 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 27860                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 27861                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27862 00004F4B 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 27863 00004F4F 07                      	POP	ES
 27864                                  	;retn
 27865                                  
 27866                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27867                                  
 27868                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27869                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27870                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 27871                                  
 27872 00004F50 C3                      	retn	
 27873                                  
 27874                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 27875                                  ;   of the disk...
 27876                                  
 27877                                  ads7:   
 27878 00004F51 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27879 00004F56 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 27880                                  
 27881                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 27882                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 27883                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 27884                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 27885                                  ;
 27886                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27887                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 27888                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 27889                                  
 27890 00004F58 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 27891 00004F59 BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27892 00004F5C E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 27893 00004F5F 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 27894                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27895                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 27896                                                                  ;   setup.
 27897 00004F60 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 27898 00004F62 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27899                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 27900                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 27901                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 27902 00004F65 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 27903 00004F6A F9                              STC
 27904 00004F6B C3                              retn
 27905                                  
 27906                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27907                                  ;
 27908                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 27909                                  ;
 27910                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 27911                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27912                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27913                                  
 27914                                  RESTFATBYT:
 27915 00004F6C 53                              PUSH    BX
 27916 00004F6D 52                              PUSH    DX
 27917 00004F6E 57                              PUSH    DI
 27918 00004F6F 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27919 00004F71 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 27920 00004F75 E8DC06                  	call	PACK
 27921 00004F78 5F                              POP     DI
 27922 00004F79 5A                              POP     DX
 27923 00004F7A 5B                              POP     BX
 27924                                  ; 16/12/2022
 27925                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27926                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 27927 00004F7B C3                      	retn
 27928                                  
 27929                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 27930                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27931                                  ;
 27932                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 27933                                  ;
 27934                                  ; Inputs:
 27935                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 27936                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27937                                  ; Function:
 27938                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 27939                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27940                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 27941                                  ;
 27942                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27943                                  
 27944                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27945                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27946                                  RELEASE:
 27947 00004F7C 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 27948                                  
 27949                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 27950                                  RELBLKS:
 27951                                  
 27952                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 27953                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 27954                                  
 27955 00004F7E E87F06                  	call	UNPACK
 27956 00004F81 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27957 00004F83 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 27958 00004F85 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 27959 00004F87 52                              PUSH    DX
 27960 00004F88 E8C906                  	call	PACK
 27961 00004F8B 5A                              POP     DX
 27962 00004F8C 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27963 00004F8E 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 27964 00004F90 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 27965                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27966                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27967 00004F92 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27968 00004F97 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 27969 00004F99 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 27970                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 27971 00004F9D 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 27972 00004F9F 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 27973 00004FA0 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 27974 00004FA2 E84406                  	call	IsEOF
 27975 00004FA5 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 27976                                  
 27977                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27978                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27979                                  ;%if 0
 27980                                  RELEASE_flush:
 27981                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27982 00004FA7 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27983                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 27984 00004FAB 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 27985 00004FAC 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 27986 00004FAD 06                      	push	es
 27987 00004FAE 55                      	push	bp
 27988 00004FAF E86E0B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 27989 00004FB2 5D                      	pop	bp
 27990 00004FB3 07                      	pop	es
 27991 00004FB4 59                      	pop	cx
 27992 00004FB5 5E                      	pop	si
 27993                                  ;%endif
 27994                                  RET12:
 27995 00004FB6 C3                      	retn
 27996                                  
 27997                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 27998                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27999                                  ;
 28000                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 28001                                  ;
 28002                                  ; Inputs:
 28003                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 28004                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 28005                                  ;       DS = CS
 28006                                  ; Outputs:
 28007                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 28008                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28009                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 28010                                  ;
 28011                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28012                                  
 28013                                  GETEOF:
 28014 00004FB7 E84606                  	call	UNPACK
 28015 00004FBA 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 28016 00004FBC 53                              PUSH    BX
 28017 00004FBD 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28018 00004FBF E82706                  	call	IsEOF
 28019 00004FC2 5B                              POP     BX
 28020 00004FC3 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 28021 00004FC5 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28022 00004FC7 EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 28023

 28030                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 28031                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 28032                                  
 28033                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 28034                                  ;		  filename characters
 28035                                  ;
 28036                                  ;	MakeFcb
 28037                                  ;	NameTrans
 28038                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 28039                                  ;	GetLet
 28040                                  ;	UCase
 28041                                  ;	GetLet3
 28042                                  ;	GetCharType
 28043                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 28044                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 28045                                  ;	DELIM
 28046                                  ;
 28047                                  ;	Revision history:
 28048                                  ;
 28049                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 28050                                  ;	
 28051                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 28052                                  
 28053                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 28054                                  
 28055                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 28056                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 28057                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 28058                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 28059                                  
 28060                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28061                                  ;
 28062                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 28063                                  ;
 28064                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28065                                  
 28066                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28067                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28068                                  MAKEFCB:
 28069                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28070 00004FC9 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 28071 00004FCF 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 28072                                  	;test	al,2
 28073 00004FD1 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 28074 00004FD3 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 28075 00004FD5 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 28076                                  DEFDRV:
 28077 00004FD9 47                      	INC	DI
 28078 00004FDA B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 28079                                  	;test	al,4
 28080 00004FDD A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 28081 00004FDF 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 28082 00004FE0 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 28083 00004FE2 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 28084 00004FE4 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28085 00004FE6 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 28086                                  FILLB:
 28087 00004FE8 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28088 00004FEA B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 28089 00004FEC F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 28090 00004FEF 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 28091 00004FF1 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28092 00004FF3 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 28093                                  FILLB2:
 28094 00004FF5 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28095 00004FF7 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 28096 00004FF8 AB                      	STOSW
 28097 00004FF9 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 28098 00004FFA 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 28099                                  	;test	bl,1
 28100 00004FFD F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 28101 00005000 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC

 28226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28227                                  ;
 28228                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 28229                                  ;
 28230                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 28231                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 28232                                  ;
 28233                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 28234                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 28235                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 28236                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 28237                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 28238                                  ;
 28239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28240                                  
 28241                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28242                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28243                                  NameTrans:
 28244                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28245 0000509A 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 28246 000050A0 16                      	push	ss
 28247 000050A1 07                      	pop	es
 28248                                  
 28249                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28250 000050A2 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28251 000050A5 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28252 000050A6 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 28253 000050A9 B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 28254 000050AC AA                      	STOSB
 28255 000050AD F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 28256 000050AF 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 28257 000050B1 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 28258 000050B3 AA                      	STOSB
 28259 000050B4 5F                      	POP	DI
 28260                                  
 28261 000050B5 E87BFF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 28262                                  
 28263                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 28264 000050B8 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 28265 000050BE 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 28266 000050C0 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 28267 000050C6 C3                      	retn

 28276                                  
 28277                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 28278                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 28279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28280                                  
 28281                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 28282                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 28283                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 28284                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 28285                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 28286                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 28287                                  
 28288                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 28289                                  ;CharType:
 28290                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28291                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 28292                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28293                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 28294                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28295                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 28296                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28297                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 28298                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28299                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 28300                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28301                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 28302                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28303                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 28304                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28305                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 28306                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28307                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 28308                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28309                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 28310                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28311                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 28312                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28313                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 28314                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28315                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 28316                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28317                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28319                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 28320                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28321                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 28322                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 28323                                  ;	      ; # and "
 28324                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 28325                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 28326                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 28327                                  ;	      ; + and *
 28328                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28329                                  ;	      ; - and '
 28330                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 28331                                  ;	      ; / and .
 28332                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28333                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 28334                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 28335                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 28336                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28337                                  ;	      ; = and <
 28338                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28339                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 28340                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28341                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 28342                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 28343                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 28344                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28345                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 28346                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28347                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 28348                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 28349                                  ;	      ; } and |
 28350                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28351                                  
 28352                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 28353                                  ;					; character in the table
 28354

 28356                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter

 28419                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28420                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28421                                  
 28422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28423                                  ;
 28424                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 28425                                  ;
 28426                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 28427                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 28428                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 28429                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 28430                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 28431                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 28432                                  ;
 28433                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 28434                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 28435                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 28436                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 28437                                  ;
 28438                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 28439                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 28440                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 28441                                  ;
 28442                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28443                                  
 28444                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 28445                                  
 28446                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 28447                                  GETLET:	
 28448 00005106 AC                      	LODSB
 28449                                  
 28450                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 28451                                  
 28452                                  	;entry	UCase
 28453                                  UCase:	
 28454                                  	; 09/08/2018
 28455                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 28456                                  _UCase:
 28457 00005107 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28458 00005108 BB[310B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 28459                                  
 28460                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 28461                                  
 28462                                  gl_0:
 28463 0000510B 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 28464 0000510D 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 28465 0000510F 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 28466 00005111 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 28467 00005113 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 28468                                  
 28469                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 28470                                  
 28471                                  gl_1:
 28472 00005115 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 28473 00005117 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 28474 00005119 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 28475                                  
 28476                                  	; M048 - Start 
 28477                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 28478                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 28479                                  	; preserve it.
 28480                                  
 28481                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28482                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28483                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28484                                  	;CS	XLAT
 28485                                  
 28486                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28487                                  
 28488                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28489 0000511B 1E                      	push	ds
 28490                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 28491 0000511C 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 28492 00005121 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28493 00005122 1F                      	pop	ds
 28494                                  
 28495                                  	; M048 - End
 28496                                  
 28497                                  ; Now check the type
 28498                                  
 28499                                  ;If TableLook
 28500                                  gl_2:
 28501                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28502 00005123 50                      	PUSH	AX
 28503                                  
 28504                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28505                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 28506                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 28507                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 28508                                  	;cs	xlat	
 28509                                  	
 28510                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28511 00005124 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 28512                                  	
 28513                                  	;test	al,1	
 28514 00005127 A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character

 28631                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28632                                  ;
 28633                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 28634                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 28635                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 28636                                  ;
 28637                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 28638                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 28639                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 28640                                  ;
 28641                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28642                                  
 28643                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28644                                  
 28645                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28646                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28647                                  GetCharType:
 28648                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 28649 0000513F 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 28650 00005141 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 28651                                  
 28652 00005143 53                      	push	bx
 28653 00005144 BB[C750]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 28654 00005147 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 28655                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 28656 00005149 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 28657 0000514B 5B                      	pop	bx
 28658                                  
 28659                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 28660                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 28661                                  
 28662 0000514C 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 28663                                  
 28664 0000514E D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 28665 00005150 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28666 00005152 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28667 00005154 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28668                                  gct_80:
 28669 00005156 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 28670 00005158 C3                      	retn
 28671                                  gct_90:
 28672 00005159 B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 28673 0000515B C3                      	retn
 28674

 28691 00005168 C3                      	retn

 28701                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 28702                                  
 28703                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 28704                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 28705                                  
 28706                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 28707                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 28708                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 28709                                  ;
 28710                                  ;	FATAL
 28711                                  ;	FATAL1
 28712                                  ;	reset_environment
 28713                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 28714                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 28715                                  ;	STATCHK
 28716                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 28717                                  ;	DIVOV
 28718                                  ;	CHARHARD
 28719                                  ;	HardErr
 28720                                  ;
 28721                                  ;	Revision history:
 28722                                  ;
 28723                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 28724                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 28725                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 28726                                  ;
 28727                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 28728                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 28729                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 28730                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 28731                                  ;
 28732                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 28733                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 28734                                  ;	      charhard.
 28735

 29069                                  	; !! NOTE: FALL THROUGH !!
 29070                                  
 29071                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29072                                  ;
 29073                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 29074                                  ;
 29075                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 29076                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 29077                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 29078                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 29079                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 29080                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 29081                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 29082                                  ; is simulated.
 29083                                  ;
 29084                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29085                                  
 29086                                  CNTCHAND:
 29087                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 29088                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 29089                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 29090                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29091                                  
 29092                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29093 000052B4 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 29094 000052BA 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29095                                  
 29096 000052BC B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 29097 000052BE E8B6C4                          CALL	BUFOUT
 29098 000052C1 E851C3                          CALL	CRLF
 29099                                  around_deadlock:
 29100 000052C4 16                              PUSH    SS
 29101 000052C5 1F                              POP     DS
 29102 000052C6 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 29103 000052CB 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 29104 000052CD E869E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 29105                                  NOSWAP:
 29106 000052D0 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 29107 000052D1 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 29108 000052D5 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 29109 000052D9 E8B8B1                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 29110                                  
 29111                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 29112                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 29113                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 29114                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 29115                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 29116                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 29117                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 29118                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29119                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 29120                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 29121                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 29122                                  			; else
 29123                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 29124                                  
 29125                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29126                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 29127                                  
 29128                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 29129                                  	
 29130 000052DC 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 29131                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 29132 000052DD 1E                      	push	ds
 29133                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29134 000052DE 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29135 000052E3 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 29136 000052E8 C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 29137 000052ED 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 29138                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 29139 000052F1 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 29140                                  
 29141 000052F6 803E[1112]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29142 000052FB 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 29143 000052FC 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29144 000052FE F8                      	CLC				
 29145 000052FF CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29146 00005301 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 29147                                  
 29148                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29149                                  do_low_int23:
 29150 00005303 F8                      	clc
 29151 00005304 2EFF1E[6951]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 29152                                  
 29153                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 29154                                  
 29155                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 29156                                  
 29157                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 29158                                  ;
 29159                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 29160                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 29161                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 29162                                  ;
 29163                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 29164                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 29165                                  
 29166                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 29167                                  
 29168 00005309 FA                      	CLI
 29169                                  
 29170                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 29171                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 29172                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 29173                                  	;POP	AX
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29176                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29177                                  
 29178                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 29179                                  
 29180 0000530A 50                      	push	ax
 29181 0000530B 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 29182                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29183 0000530D 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29184 00005312 A3[0A0D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 29185 00005315 58                      	pop	ax
 29186 00005316 A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 29187 00005319 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 29188 0000531A 58                      	pop	ax
 29189                                  
 29190                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 29191                                  
 29192                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29193                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 29194                                  	;JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 29195

 29198 0000531F 750A                    	JNZ     SHORT ctrlc_try_new ; current SP not the same as saved SP
 29199                                  
 29200                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 29201                                  
 29202                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 29203                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29204                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 29205                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29206                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29207 00005321 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]

 29209                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 29210                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 29211                                  COMMANDJ:
 29212 00005328 E91CB0                  	JMP	COMMAND
 29213                                  
 29214                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 29215                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 29216                                  
 29217                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 29218 0000532B 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 29219                                  	;;test	ax,1
 29220                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 29221 0000532E A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 29222 00005330 74EF                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 29223                                  
 29224                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29225 00005332 8E1E[0A0D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 29226                                  
 29227                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 29228                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 29229                                  
 29230                                  ctrlc_abort:
 29231                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29232                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0

 29238

 29242 00005339 1E                      	push	ds
 29243                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29244 0000533A 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]

 29248 00005345 EBE1                    	JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ

 29423                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29424                                  ;
 29425                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 29426                                  ;
 29427                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 29428                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 29429                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 29430                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 29431                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 29432                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 29433                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 29434                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 29435                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 29436                                  ; Output:
 29437                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 29438                                  ;
 29439                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29440                                  
 29441                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29442                                  HARDERR:
