 29444                                  	; 30/07/2018
 29445                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 29447                                          ;and	di,0FFh

 29449                                          ;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?

 29453 000053D0 50                              PUSH    AX

 29456                                          ;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 29481                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 29482                                  	;mov	word [ES:BP+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0 - 05/05/2019

 29497 0000540F 360A26[4B03]            	OR	AH,[SS:ALLOWED]		; Set the allowed_ bits

 29508                                  FATAL1:

 29516                                  
 29517                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code 
 29518                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the 
 29519                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY 
 29520                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up 
 29521                                  	; table alone.
 29522                                  
 29523                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29524                                  FATALC:
 29525 00005428 E89701                  	call	SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 29526                                  	;cmp	di,0Ch
 29527 0000542B 83FF0C                  	CMP	DI,error_I24_gen_failure
 29528 0000542E 7603                    	JBE	short GOT_RIGHT_CODE	; Error codes above gen_failure get
 29529 00005430 BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 29530                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError
 29531                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 29532                                  ;
 29533                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 29534                                  ;
 29535                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 29536                                  ;
 29537                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 29538                                  ;     EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.
 29539                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------
 29540                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 29541                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 29542                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 29543 00005433 36803E[2003]00          	CMP     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 29544 00005439 7404                            JZ	SHORT NoSetFail

 29546 0000543D EB6C                    	JMP	short FailRet
 29547                                  NoSetFail:
 29548 0000543F 368926[8805]                    MOV     [SS:CONTSTK],SP		; SS override
 29549 00005444 16                              PUSH	SS
 29550 00005445 07                              POP	ES
 29551                                      
 29552                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 29553                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may 
 29554                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then 
 29555                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 29556                                  
 29557 00005446 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh

 29568                                  					; Prepare to play with stack

 29570 00005460 36FE0E[2103]                    DEC     BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; INT 24 handler might not return
 29571                                  
 29572                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSDOS 6.21)
 29573                                  
 29574                                  	;; Extended Open hooks
 29575                                  					; AN000;IFS.I24 error disabled
 29576                                  	;test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],2

 29579                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 29590                                  					; must preserve ES

 29593 00005481 7504                    	jne	short do_low_int24	; Y: the int must be done from low mem

 29595                                  					; must preserve ES

 29599                                  	; 05/05/2019
 29600                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29601 00005487 2EFF1E[6D51]            	call    far [cs:LowInt24Addr]
 29602                                  criterr_ret_addr:
 29603 0000548C 268926[8405]                    MOV     [ES:USER_SP],SP         ; restore our stack
 29604 00005491 268C16[8605]                    MOV     [ES:USER_SS],SS

 29606 00005498 8ED5                            MOV     SS,BP
 29607                                  passi24:

 29609 0000549F 36FE06[2103]                    INC     BYTE [SS:INDOS]		; Back in the DOS
 29610 000054A4 36C606[2003]00                  MOV     BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; Back from INT 24
 29611 000054AA FB                              STI
 29612                                  FailRet:
 29613 000054AB 36C42E[8005]                    LES     BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 29614                                  	
 29615                                  	; 08/07/2018
 29616                                  
 29617                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 29618                                  
 29619 000054B0 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1

 29626

 29631 000054C0 7443                    	jz	short DoAbort	; No, do abort

 29641                                  CleanUp:

 29645                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 29646                                  	;retn
 29647                                  	; 17/12/2022
 29648 000054DD 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29649                                  CleanUp2:
 29650 000054DF 1E                      	push	ds
 29651 000054E0 56                      	push	si
 29652 000054E1 50                      	push	ax
 29653 000054E2 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]

 29659                                  Cleanup_retn:

 29661                                  
 29662                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 29663                                  
 29664                                  CheckIgnore:
 29665                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 29666 000054F1 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 29667 000054F7 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			 ; No, do fail
 29668 000054F9 EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 29669                                  
 29670                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 29671                                  
 29672                                  CheckRetry:
 29673                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],10h
 29674 000054FB 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 29675 00005501 74BF                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 29676 00005503 EBCC                    	JMP	short CleanUp
 29677                                  
 29678                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 29679                                  DoAbort:
 29680 00005505 16                      	push	ss
 29681 00005506 1F                      	pop	ds
 29682                                  
 29683 00005507 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 29684 0000550C 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 29685 0000550E E828DE                  	call	SWAPBACK
 29686                                  NOSWAP2:
 29687                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 29688                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 29689                                  
 29690                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 29691                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 29692

 29696                                  	; Set return code
 29697                                  
 29698 00005518 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 29699 0000551D 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 29700                                  
 29701                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 29702                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 29703                                  
 29704 0000551F E9990D                  	jmp	exit_inner
 29705                                  
 29706                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29707                                  ;
 29708                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 29709                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 29710                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 29711                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 29712                                  ;
 29713                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 29714                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 29715                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 29716                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 29717                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 29718                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 29719                                  ;
 29720                                  ; output:   none.
 29721                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29722                                  
 29723                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 29724                                  	
 29725                                  reset_environment:
 29726                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29727                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 29728                                  
 29729                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 29730                                  
 29731 00005522 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 29732                                  
 29733                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 29734                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 29735                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 29736                                  
 29737 00005523 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 29738                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 29739                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 29740 00005525 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 29741                                  
 29742                                  					; SS override
 29743 00005527 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 29744                                  
 29745                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 29746                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 29747                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 29748                                  					; On process exit.
 29749 0000552D B82211                  	mov     ax, 1122h
 29750 00005530 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 29751                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 29752                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 29753 00005532 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 29754 00005534 E8CDB9                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 29755                                  
 29756 00005537 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 29757 00005538 06                      	push	es
 29758 00005539 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 29759

 29761 0000553F 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX

 29763                                  
 29764                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 29765                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper 
 29766                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process

 29771 0000554A 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB

 29773                                  
 29774                                  					; SS override
 29775                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3

 29778                                  
 29779                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks 
 29780                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 29781                                  
 29782                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 29783 00005555 E89B0D                  	call	arena_free_process
 29784                                  
 29785                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal 
 29786                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that 
 29787                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 29788

 29795                                  
 29796                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 29797                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA

 29799 00005561 1F                      	pop	ds	
 29800                                  
 29801 00005562 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 29802

 29804                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 29805

 29807 00005564 E821BE                  	call	ECritDisk

 29814

 29830

 29833                                  
 29834                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29835 00005598 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG

 29880                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29881                                  ;
 29882                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 29883                                  ;
 29884                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 29885                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 29886                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 29887                                  ;
 29888                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29889                                  
 29890                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 29891 000055C2 50                      	PUSH	AX
 29892                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 29893 000055C3 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End

 29895                                  					; Change to dosdata to access 
 29896                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 29897                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29898

 29900 000055C9 1E                      	push	ds

 29902 000055CA 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]

 29905                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.

 29936                                  
 29937                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 29938                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 29939                                  
 29940                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 29941                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29942                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 29943                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 29944                                  ;
 29945                                  ;	IsEof
 29946                                  ;	UNPACK
 29947                                  ;	PACK
 29948                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 29949                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 29950                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 29951                                  ;	FAT_operation
 29952                                  ;
 29953                                  ;	Revision history:
 29954                                  ;
 29955                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 29956                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 29957                                  ;
 29958                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 29959                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 29960                                  
 29961                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29962                                  
 29963                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 29964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29965                                  ;
 29966                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 29967                                  ;
 29968                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 29969                                  ;
 29970                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 29971                                  ;		BX has fat value
 29972                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 29973                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 29974                                  ;
 29975                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29976                                  
 29977                                  IsEOF:
 29978                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 29979 000055E9 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 29980 000055EF 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 29981                                  
 29982                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 29983                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 29984                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 29985                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 29986                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 29987                                  
 29988 000055F1 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 29989 000055F5 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 29990                                  
 29991 000055F7 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 29992                                  IsEOF_other:
 29993 000055FB C3                      	retn
 29994                                  EOF16:
 29995 000055FC 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 29996 000055FF C3                      	retn
 29997                                  
 29998                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29999                                  
 30000                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30001                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30002                                  ;
 30003                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 30004                                  ;
 30005                                  ; Inputs:
 30006                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30007                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 30008                                  ; Outputs:
 30009                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 30010                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 30011                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30012                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 30013                                  ;
 30014                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 30015                                  ;
 30016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30017                                  	
 30018                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30019                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30020                                  
 30021                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30022                                  UNPACK:
 30023                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 30024 00005600 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 30025 00005602 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 30026 00005604 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 30027 00005608 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 30028 0000560A C3                      	retn				; done
 30029                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 30030                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30031                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 30032 0000560B 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 30033 0000560F 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 30034 00005611 E8DC00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30035 00005614 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 30036 00005616 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 30037 00005618 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 30038 0000561A 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30039 0000561E 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 30040 00005622 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 30041 00005624 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 30042 00005626 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 30043                                  High12:
 30044 00005628 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30045 0000562A D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30046 0000562C D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30047 0000562E D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30048                                  Unpack12:
 30049 00005630 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 30050                                  _DoContext:
 30051 00005634 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30052 00005635 1F                      	POP	DS
 30053 00005636 C3                      	retn
 30054                                  HURTFAT:
 30055                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 30056                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30057 00005637 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30058 0000563D 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30059 0000563E B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 30060                                  
 30061                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30062 00005640 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 30063                                  ;
 30064                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 30065                                  ;
 30066 00005646 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 30067 00005649 E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 30068 0000564C 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30069 0000564E F8                      	CLC
 30070 0000564F 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 30071 00005651 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30072                                  OKU_RET:
 30073 00005652 58                      	POP	AX
 30074                                  hurtfat_retn:
 30075 00005653 C3                      	retn
 30076                                  
 30077                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30078                                  
 30079                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30081                                  ;
 30082                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 30083                                  ;
 30084                                  ; Inputs:
 30085                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 30086                                  ;	DX = Data
 30087                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 30088                                  ; Outputs:
 30089                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 30090                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 30091                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30092                                  ;	No other registers affected
 30093                                  ;
 30094                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 30095                                  ;
 30096                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30097                                  
 30098                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30099                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30100                                  PACK:
 30101                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 30102 00005654 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 30103 00005656 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 30104 00005658 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 30105 0000565C C3                      	retn				; done
 30106                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 30107                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30108 0000565D E89000                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30109 00005660 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 30110 00005662 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 30111 00005664 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 30112 00005666 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 30113 00005667 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 30114 00005669 D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 30115 0000566B 59                      	POP	CX
 30116 0000566C 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 30117 0000566F EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 30118                                  ALIGNED:
 30119                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30120 00005671 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 30121 00005677 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 30122 00005679 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 30123 0000567D 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 30124 00005681 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 30125                                  Pack16:
 30126 00005683 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 30127                                  PACKIN:
 30128 00005685 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 30129 00005687 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 30130                                  
 30131                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30132 00005689 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 30133                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30134 0000568E F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30135                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30136 00005692 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30137                                  	; 10/06/2019
 30138 00005694 E89105                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30139                                  	
 30140                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 30141 00005697 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30142                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 30143                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30144 0000569B 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 30145                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30146 000056A1 16                      	push	ss
 30147 000056A2 1F                      	pop	ds
 30148 000056A3 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 30149 000056A5 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30150 000056A6 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30151 000056A7 51                      	PUSH	CX
 30152 000056A8 A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 30153 000056AB 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 30154                                  	;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30155                                  	;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30156 000056AF 83C614                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 30157 000056B2 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 30158                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30159                                  	;Context DS
 30160 000056B4 16                      	push	ss
 30161 000056B5 1F                      	pop	ds
 30162                                  	
 30163 000056B6 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30164                                  	
 30165                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30166 000056B7 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30167 000056BB 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30168                                  
 30169                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30170 000056BF 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 30171 000056C3 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30172 000056C6 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30173 000056C8 E85903                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30174 000056CB 58                      	POP	AX
 30175 000056CC 721C                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 30176 000056CE C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 30177                                  	
 30178                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30179 000056D2 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30180                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30181 000056D6 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30182 000056D8 E84D05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30183                                  	
 30184                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 30185 000056DB 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 30186                                  yesdirty12:
 30187                                  	;;add	di,16
 30188                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30189 000056DF 83C714                  	ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30190 000056E2 4F                      	DEC	DI
 30191                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 30192 000056E3 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30193 000056E7 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 30194 000056E9 F8                      	CLC
 30195                                  POPP_RET:
 30196 000056EA 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30197 000056EB 1F                      	POP	DS
 30198 000056EC 59                      	POP	CX
 30199 000056ED 5B                      	POP	BX
 30200 000056EE 58                      	POP	AX
 30201 000056EF C3                      	retn
 30202                                  
 30203                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30204                                  
 30205                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 30206                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30207                                  ;
 30208                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 30209                                  ;
 30210                                  ; Inputs:
 30211                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 30212                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 30213                                  ; Function:
 30214                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 30215                                  ; Outputs:
 30216                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 30217                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 30218                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 30219                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 30220                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 30221                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 30222                                  ;
 30223                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30224                                  
 30225                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30226                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30227                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30228                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30229                                  
 30230                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 30231                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 30232 000056F0 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 30233                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 30234 000056F5 50                      	push	ax
 30235 000056F6 53                      	push	bx
 30236 000056F7 51                      	push	cx
 30237 000056F8 52                      	push	dx
 30238 000056F9 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 30239 000056FB 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 30240 00005701 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 30241 00005703 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 30242                                  Map16:	
 30243                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 30244 00005705 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 30245                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30246 00005707 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 30247 00005709 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 30248 0000570B 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30249                                  
 30250                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30251                                  ;
 30252                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 30253                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 30254                                  ;
 30255                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 30256                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 30257                                  ;
 30258                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 30259                                  
 30260 0000570F 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 30261 00005713 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 30262 00005715 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 30263 00005717 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 30264 0000571B 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 30265                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 30266                                  	;shr	al,1	
 30267                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 30268 0000571D D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 30269 0000571F D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 30270                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30271 00005721 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 30272 00005723 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 30273                                  _DoDiv:
 30274                                  ;ENDIF
 30275                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30276                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 30277                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30278 00005725 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 30279                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 30280 00005727 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 30281                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30282                                  DivDone:
 30283                                  ;ENDIF
 30284                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 30285 00005729 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 30286 0000572D 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 30287                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 30288 0000572E 50                      	push	ax
 30289 0000572F 52                      	push	dx
 30290 00005730 51                      	push	cx
 30291 00005731 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 30292                                  
 30293                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30294 00005733 C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 30295                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30296 00005739 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30297 0000573B BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30298                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30299 0000573E E8E302                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30300                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 30301 00005741 59                      	pop	cx
 30302 00005742 58                      	pop	ax
 30303 00005743 5A                      	pop	dx
 30304 00005744 7257                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30305                                  
 30306 00005746 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30307                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 30308                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30309 0000574A 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30310 0000574D 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 30311 0000574F 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 30312 00005751 7537                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 30313 00005753 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30314                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30315 00005755 16                      	push	ss
 30316 00005756 1F                      	pop	ds	
 30317 00005757 FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 30318 0000575B A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 30319 0000575E 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 30320                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30321 00005762 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 30322 00005768 42                      	INC	DX
 30323 00005769 C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 30324                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30325 0000576F 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30326 00005771 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30327                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30328 00005774 E8AD02                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30329 00005777 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30330 00005779 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30331 0000577D 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30332 00005780 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30333                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30334 00005782 16                      	push	ss
 30335 00005783 1F                      	pop	ds
 30336 00005784 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 30337                                  
 30338                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 30339 00005787 BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 30340                                  MAPRET:
 30341                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 30342 0000578A 5A                      	pop	dx
 30343 0000578B 59                      	pop	cx
 30344 0000578C 5B                      	pop	bx
 30345 0000578D 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 30346 0000578F 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30347 00005795 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 30348 00005797 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 30349                                  MapSet:
 30350 00005799 A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 30351                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 30352 0000579B 58                      	pop	ax
 30353 0000579C C3                      	retn
 30354                                  
 30355                                  MAP_POP:
 30356                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 30357 0000579D 5A                      	pop	dx
 30358 0000579E 59                      	pop	cx
 30359 0000579F 5B                      	pop	bx
 30360 000057A0 58                      	pop	ax
 30361                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 30362 000057A1 C3                      	retn
 30363                                  
 30364                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30365                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30366                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30367                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30368                                  
 30369                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 30370                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30371                                  ;
 30372                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 30373                                  ;
 30374                                  ; Inputs:
 30375                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30376                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 30377                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 30378                                  ; Function:
 30379                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 30380                                  ;	if disk changed.
 30381                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 30382                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 30383                                  ; Outputs:
 30384                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30385                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 30386                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 30387                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 30388                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 30389                                  ;
 30390                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30391                                  
 30392                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 30393 000057A2 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 30394                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30395                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30396                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30397 000057A6 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30398 000057AA A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30399 000057AD E8CBAE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30400                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30401                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30402 000057B0 EB78                    	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30403                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 30404                                  	;retn
 30405                                  
 30406                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30407                                  ;
 30408                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 30409                                  ;
 30410                                  ; Inputs:
 30411                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 30412                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30413                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 30414                                  ; Function:
 30415                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 30416                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 30417                                  ; Outputs:
 30418                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 30419                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 30420                                  ;	THISDRV set
 30421                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30422                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 30423                                  ;
 30424                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30425                                  
 30426                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30427                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30428                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30429                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30430                                  
 30431                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 30432 000057B2 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30433 000057B3 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30434                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 30435 000057B4 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30436                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30437                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30438                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30439 000057B8 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30440 000057BC A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30441 000057BF E8B9AE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30442 000057C2 E86500                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30443 000057C5 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 30444 000057C6 07                      	POP	ES
 30445 000057C7 72D8                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 30446 000057C9 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 30447                                  
 30448                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 30449                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 30450                                  
 30451                                  MED_CHANGE:
 30452 000057CB 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 30453 000057CD 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 30454 000057CE 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30455 000057CF 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 30456 000057D3 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 30457                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 30458 000057D5 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 30459                                  
 30460                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30461                                  
 30462                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 30463                                  ;
 30464                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 30465                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 30466                                  
 30467 000057D9 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 30468                                  frcd20: 
 30469                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 30470                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 30471 000057DE 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 30472 000057E3 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 30473                                  
 30474                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30475                                  	;push	es
 30476                                  	;push	di
 30477                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 30478                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30479                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 30480                                  	;pop	di
 30481                                  	;pop	es
 30482                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 30483                                  
 30484                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30485 000057E5 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30486 000057E9 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 30487 000057EB 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 30488 000057ED 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 30489 000057F1 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 30490                                  
 30491                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30492                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 30493 000057F3 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 30494 000057F7 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 30495                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 30496 000057F9 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 30497                                  frcd25:	
 30498                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30499                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 30500 000057FD 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 30501 00005800 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 30502 00005802 1F                      	POP	DS
 30503                                  NO_CHANGE:
 30504 00005803 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 30505 00005807 F8                      	CLC
 30506 00005808 C3                      	retn
 30507                                  
 30508                                  ;Break	<Fat_Operation - miscellaneous fat stuff>
 30509                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30510                                  ;
 30511                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 30512                                  ;
 30513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30514                                  
 30515                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30516                                  
 30517                                  FAT_operation:
 30518                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30519                                  FATERR:
 30520                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 30521                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30522 00005809 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 30523                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30524                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 30525 0000580F 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 30526                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 30527 00005813 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 30528                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 30529 00005818 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 30530 0000581A A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 30531 0000581D E8F8FB                  	call	FATAL1
 30532 00005820 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 30533 00005824 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30534 00005826 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 30535 00005828 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30536 00005829 C3                      	retn
 30537                                  
 30538                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 30539                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30540 0000582A 16                      	push	ss			
 30541 0000582B 1F                      	pop	ds
 30542                                  	;mov	al,0Fh
 30543 0000582C B00F                    	MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 30544                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 30545 0000582E 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT] 
 30546 00005832 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 30547 00005835 C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 30548 0000583A C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 30549                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30550                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30551 00005840 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30552 00005844 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 30553 00005847 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30554 00005848 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30555                                  
 30556                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 30557 00005849 BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 30558                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 30559                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30560 0000584C 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 30561 00005850 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 30562 00005851 E8B4EE                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 30563                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30564 00005854 16                      	push	ss
 30565 00005855 1F                      	pop	ds
 30566 00005856 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 30567 00005857 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 30568                                  	;test	di,8000h
 30569                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 30570 0000585B 09FF                    	or	di,di
 30571 0000585D 78AA                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 30572 0000585F 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 30573                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 30574                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30575 00005861 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 30576 00005865 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 30577                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 30578 00005868 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 30579 0000586C 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 30580 0000586E C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1
 30581 00005873 E9A700                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 30582                                  					; new volume label.
 30583                                  CHECK_BYT:
 30584 00005876 0A26[6803]              	OR	AH,[CALLRBYT]
 30585                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30586                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 30587                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30588 0000587A 7865                    	js	short NEWDSK
 30589                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30590                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30591                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 30592                                  
 30593                                  CHECK_ZR:
 30594 0000587C 743C                    	JZ	short CHKBUFFDIRT	; jump if I don't know
 30595 0000587E F8                      	CLC
 30596 0000587F C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 30597                                  
 30598                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:
 30599 00005880 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30600 00005881 55                      	PUSH	BP
 30601                                  	;;les	bp,[es:bp+12h]
 30602                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30603 00005882 26C46E13                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Get device pointer
 30604                                  	;;test	word [es:bp+4],800h
 30605                                  	;TEST	word [ES:BP+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVOPCL ; Did it set vol id?
 30606 00005886 26F6460508              	test	byte [es:bp+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVOPCL>>8)
 30607 0000588B 5D                      	POP	BP
 30608 0000588C 07                      	POP	ES
 30609 0000588D 7426                    	JZ	short FAIL_OPJ2		; Nope, FAIL
 30610 0000588F 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save buffer pointer for ignore
 30611 00005890 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30612 00005891 16                      	push	ss			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30613 00005892 1F                      	pop	ds
 30614                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 30615 00005893 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 30616 00005898 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30617 00005899 C43E[6903]              	LES	DI,[CALLVIDM]		; Get volume ID pointer
 30618 0000589D 8C06[2A03]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT+2],ES
 30619 000058A1 07                      	POP	ES
 30620 000058A2 893E[2803]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT],DI
 30621                                  	;mov	ax,0Fh
 30622 000058A6 B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_I24_wrong_disk
 30623 000058A9 C606[7505]01            	MOV	byte [READOP],1		; Write
 30624                                  	;invoke	HARDERR
 30625 000058AE E815FB                  	call	HARDERR
 30626 000058B1 5F                      	POP	DI			; Get back buffer for ignore
 30627 000058B2 1F                      	POP	DS
 30628 000058B3 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30629                                  FAIL_OPJ2:
 30630 000058B5 741D                    	JZ	short FAIL_OP
 30631 000058B7 E970FF                  	JMP	FAT_GOT_DPB		; Retry
 30632                                  
 30633                                  CHKBUFFDIRT:
 30634                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30635                                  
 30636                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30637                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 30638                                  
 30639                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30640 000058BA 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0	; any dirty buffers ? ;hkn;
 30641 000058C0 741F                    	je	short NEWDSK			; no, skip the check
 30642 000058C2 E8F800                  	call	GETCURHEAD			; get pointer to first buffer
 30643                                  nbuffer:
 30644                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 30645 000058C5 384504                  	cmp	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],al	; Unit OK ?
 30646 000058C8 750E                    	jne	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 30647                                  	;test   byte [di+5],40h
 30648 000058CA F6450540                	TEST	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty	; is the buffer dirty ?
 30649 000058CE 7408                    	jz	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 30650                                  	;Context DS
 30651 000058D0 16                      	push	ss
 30652 000058D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30653 000058D2 F8                      	clc
 30654 000058D3 C3                      	retn
 30655                                  
 30656                                  FAIL_OP:					; This label & code is here
 30657                                  	;Context DS				;  for reachability
 30658 000058D4 16                      	push	ss
 30659 000058D5 1F                      	pop	ds
 30660 000058D6 F9                      	STC
 30661 000058D7 C3                      	retn
 30662                                  
 30663                                  lfnxt:
 30664                                  	; 15/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30665                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30666                                  	;lds	di,[di]
 30667                                  
 30668                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30669 000058D8 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 30670                                  	;;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]	; get next buffer
 30671                                  	
 30672                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30673                                  	;cmp	di,-1
 30674                                  	;jne	short nbuffer
 30675                                  	
 30676                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30677 000058DA 36393E[BB0E]            	cmp	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di		; is this where we started ?;hkn;
 30678 000058DF 75E4                    	jne	short nbuffer			; no, check this guy also
 30679                                  
 30680                                  ; If no dirty buffers, assume Media changed
 30681                                  NEWDSK:
 30682                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 3.3
 30683                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30684 000058E1 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1	; Media changed, must
 30685                                  						;  recompute
 30686                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30687                                  	;call	SETVISIT
 30688                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30689 000058E7 E8D300                  	call	 GETCURHEAD
 30690                                  nxbuffer:
 30691                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30692                                  	;or 	byte [di+5],20h
 30693                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30694                                  	;cmp	[di+4],al
 30695 000058EA 384504                  	cmp	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],al		; This drive ?
 30696 000058ED 7510                    	jne	short lfnxt2
 30697                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 30698 000058EF F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 30699 000058F3 758B                    	jnz	short DISK_CHNG_ERR
 30700                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 30701 000058F5 C74504FF20              	mov	word [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],(buf_visit*256)+0FFh ; free up
 30702 000058FA E8D200                  	call	SCANPLACE
 30703                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30704 000058FD EB02                    	jmp	short skpbuff
 30705                                  lfnxt2:
 30706 000058FF 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 30707                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 30708                                  skpbuff:
 30709                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30710 00005901 363B3E[BB0E]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]					;hkn;
 30711 00005906 75E2                    	jne	short nxbuffer
 30712                                  
 30713 00005908 36833E[7700]00          	CMP	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;LB.  look ahead buffers ?	;AN001;
 30714 0000590E 740D                    	JZ	short GOGETBPB		;LB.  no			;AN001;
 30715 00005910 363A06[B00D]            	CMP	AL,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;LB.  same as changed drive	;AN001;
 30716 00005915 7506                    	JNZ	short GOGETBPB		;LB.  no			;AN001;
 30717 00005917 36C606[B00D]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CurSC_DRIVE],-1 ;LB.  invalidate look ahead buffers ;AN000;
 30718                                  ;lfnxt2:
 30719                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30720                                  	;call	SKIPVISIT
 30721                                  	;jnz	short nxbuffer
 30722                                  GOGETBPB:
 30723                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30724                                  	;;lds	di,[es:bp+12h]
 30725                                  	;lds	di,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0	
 30726 0000591D 26C57E13                	LDS	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 30727                                  	; 20/05/2019
 30728                                  	;test	word [di+4],2000h
 30729                                  	;TEST	word [DI+SYSDEV.ATT],ISFATBYDEV
 30730 00005921 F6450520                	TEST	byte [DI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(ISFATBYDEV>>8)
 30731 00005925 7510                    	JNZ	short GETFREEBUF
 30732                                  	;context DS	    		;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30733 00005927 16                      	push	ss
 30734 00005928 1F                      	pop	ds
 30735 00005929 BB0200                  	MOV	BX,2
 30736 0000592C E8D1FC                  	CALL	UNPACK			; Read the first FAT sector into CURBUF
 30737                                  FAIL_OPJ:
 30738 0000592F 72A3                    	JC	short FAIL_OP
 30739 00005931 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 30740 00005935 EB13                    	JMP	SHORT GOTGETBUF
 30741                                  
 30742                                  GETFREEBUF:
 30743 00005937 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Get a free buffer for BIOS to use
 30744 00005938 55                      	PUSH	BP
 30745                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30746                                  	;LDS	DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/08/2018
 30747                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30748 00005939 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX			;LB.  fake to get 1st	  ;AN000;
 30749                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30750 0000593B 368916[0706]            	MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;LB.  buffer addr	  ;AN000;
 30751 00005940 E87A00                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;LB.			  ;AN000;
 30752                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30753 00005943 E84202                  	call	BUFWRITE
 30754 00005946 5D                      	POP	BP
 30755 00005947 07                      	POP	ES
 30756                                  	;JC	short FAIL_OPJ
 30757 00005948 728A                    	jc	short FAIL_OP
 30758                                  GOTGETBUF:
 30759                                  	;;add	di,16
 30760                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30761 0000594A 83C714                  	ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30762                                  
 30763                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30764 0000594D 368C1E[6A03]            	MOV	[SS:CALLXAD+2],DS
 30765                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30766 00005952 16                      	push	ss
 30767 00005953 1F                      	pop	ds
 30768 00005954 893E[6803]              	MOV	[CALLXAD],DI
 30769                                  	;mov	al,16h
 30770 00005958 B016                    	MOV	AL,DBPBHL
 30771                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 30772 0000595A 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 30773 0000595E A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018
 30774 00005961 C606[5C03]02            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVBPB
 30775 00005966 C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 30776                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30777                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h]
 30778 0000596C 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30779 00005970 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 30780 00005973 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30781 00005974 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 30782                                  	;;push	word [es:bp+14h]
 30783                                  	;push	word [es:bp+15h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30784 00005975 26FF7615                	PUSH	WORD [ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR+2]
 30785                                  	;;push	word [es:bp+12h]
 30786                                  	;push	word [es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30787 00005979 26FF7613                	PUSH	WORD [ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 30788                                  
 30789                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 30790 0000597D BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 30791 00005980 5E                      	POP	SI
 30792 00005981 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS:SI Points to device header
 30793 00005982 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 30794                                  	;invoke	DEVIOCALL2
 30795 00005983 E882ED                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 30796 00005986 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 30797                                  	;Context DS
 30798 00005987 16                      	push	ss		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30799 00005988 1F                      	pop	ds
 30800 00005989 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 30801                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30802                                  	;test	di,8000h
 30803                                  	;jnz	short FATERRJ
 30804                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30805 0000598D 09FF                    	or	di,di
 30806 0000598F 7829                    	js	short FATERRJ 		; have error
 30807                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 30808                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h]  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30809 00005991 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 30810 00005995 C536[6C03]              	LDS	SI,[CALLBPB]

 30812                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],0 ; MSDOS 6.0

 30819                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+8]

 30822                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30823                                  	;;mov	ah,[es:bp+0Fh]

 30879                                  ;SETVISIT:

 30881                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 30882                                  ;; Inputs:

 30884                                  ;; Function:

 30886                                  ;; Outputs:

 30890                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 30891                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 30892                                  ;; No other registers altered
 30893                                  ;
 30894                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 30895                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 30896                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 30897                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 30898                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 30899                                  ;SETLOOP:

 30903                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 30904                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 30905                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP

 30974                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 30975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30976                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 30977                                  ; Inputs:
 30978                                  ;	 No Inputs
 30979                                  ; Function:
 30980                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30981                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 30982                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 30983                                  ; Outputs:
 30984                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30985                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 30986                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 30987                                  ; No other registers altered
 30988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30989                                  
 30990                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30991                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30992                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30993                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30994                                  
 30995                                  GETCURHEAD:
 30996 000059BD 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 30997 000059C2 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 30998 000059C9 36893E[BB0E]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	;save first buffer addr
 30999 000059CE C3                      	retn
 31000

 31010                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.

 31026                                  ;	retn

 31060                                  	
 31061 000059E0 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 31062 000059E2 7420                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 31063 000059E4 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 31064 000059E6 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;

 31067                                  not_first:

 31081 00005A02 891D                    	mov	[di],bx
