 31221                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 31222                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31223                                  ;
 31224                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 31225                                  ; Inputs:
 31226                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 31227                                  ; Function:
 31228                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 31229                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 31230                                  ;	   same segment
 31231                                  ;
 31232                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 31233                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 31234                                  ; No Registers altered
 31235                                  ;
 31236                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31237                                  
 31238                                  POINTCOMP:
 31239                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31240                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 31241 00005A13 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 31242 00005A15 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 31243                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 31244 00005A17 51                      	PUSH	CX
 31245 00005A18 52                      	PUSH	DX
 31246 00005A19 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 31247 00005A1B 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 31248 00005A1D 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 31249 00005A1F 5A                      	POP	DX
 31250 00005A20 59                      	POP	CX
 31251                                  _ret_label:
 31252 00005A21 C3                      	retn
 31253                                  
 31254                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31255                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 31256                                  
 31257                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 31258                                  
 31259                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31260                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31261                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 31262                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31263                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 31264                                  ; 
 31265                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31266                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31267                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 31268                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31269                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31270                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31271                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31272                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31273                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31274                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31275                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31276                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31277                                  
 31278                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31280                                  ;	GetBuffr reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 31281                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31282                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 31283                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 31284                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 31285                                  ; 
 31286                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31287                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31288                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 31289                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 31290                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31291                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31292                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31293                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31294                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31295                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31296                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31297                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31298                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31299                                  
 31300                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31301                                  	; DOSCODE:9937h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31302                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31303                                  	; DOSCODE:98DBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31304                                  GETBUFFR:
 31305 00005A22 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI
 31306                                  
 31307                                  ;	This entry point is called for FAT buffering with SI != 0
 31308                                  
 31309                                  GETBUFFRB:
 31310 00005A24 A3[9405]                	MOV	[PREREAD],AX			; save pre-read flag
 31311                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31312 00005A27 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 31313                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31314                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; mov al,[es:bp+0]
 31315 00005A2B C53E[1E00]              	LDS	DI,[LastBuffer]			; Get the recency pointer
 31316                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31317                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31318 00005A2F 368B0E[0706]            	MOV	CX,[SS:HIGH_SECTOR]		; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31319                                  
 31320                                  ;	See if this is the buffer that was most recently returned.
 31321                                  ;	A big performance win if it is.
 31322                                  
 31323 00005A34 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1				; Recency pointer valid?
 31324 00005A37 7412                    	je	short getb5			; No
 31325                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31326 00005A39 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31327 00005A3C 750D                    	JNZ	short getb5			; Wrong sector
 31328                                  	
 31329                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31330                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+8]
 31331 00005A3E 3B4D08                  	CMP	CX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31332 00005A41 7508                    	JNZ	short getb5			; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31333                                  	
 31334                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31335 00005A43 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31336                                  	;JZ	getb35				; Just asked for same buffer
 31337 00005A46 7503                    	jnz	short getb5
 31338                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31339                                  	; 17/12/2022
 31340                                  	; 28/07/2019
 31341 00005A48 E9C800                  	jmp	getb35x
 31342                                  	; 07/12/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31343                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31344                                  
 31345                                  ;	It's not the buffer most recently returned. See if it's in the
 31346                                  ;	cache.
 31347                                  ;
 31348                                  ;	(cx:dx) = sector #
 31349                                  ;	(al) = drive #
 31350                                  ;	(si) = 0 iff non fat sector, != 0 if FAT sector read
 31351                                  ;	??? list may be incomplete ???
 31352                                  
 31353                                  getb5:	
 31354                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31355                                  	;lds	di,[SS:BUFFHEAD]
 31356                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31357 00005A4B E86FFF                  	CALL	GETCURHEAD			; get Q Head
 31358                                  getb10:	
 31359                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31360 00005A4E 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31361 00005A51 750D                    	jne	short getb12			; wrong sector lo
 31362                                  	
 31363                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31364                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+8]

 31720                                  ;
 31721                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 31722                                  ;
 31723                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 31724                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 31725                                  ;
 31726                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 31727                                  ;
 31728                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31729                                  ;
 31730                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31731                                  
 31732                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 31733                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31734 00005B5F B4FF                    	mov	ah, -1 ; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 31735                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 31736 00005B61 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 31737 00005B64 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 31738 00005B66 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 31739 00005B68 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 31740                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31741 00005B6A 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31742 00005B6D F8                      	CLC
 31743 00005B6E 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 31744                                  DOBUFFER:
 31745                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 31746 00005B70 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 31747 00005B74 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 31748 00005B76 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31749                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 31750 00005B77 FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31751 00005B7A E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 31752 00005B7D 58                      	POP	AX
 31753 00005B7E 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 31754                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 31755 00005B80 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 31756                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 31757 00005B83 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 31758                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 31759 00005B86 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 31760                                  checkflush_retn:
 31761 00005B87 C3                      	retn

 31763                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>

 31766                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 31767                                  ;
 31768                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 31769                                  ;

 31771                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 31905                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 31906                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31907                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 31908                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 31909                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 31910                                  ;	code and time
 31911                                  ;

 31986                                  
 31987                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 31988                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 31989                                  
 31990                                  ; =========================================================================
 31991                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 31992                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 31993                                  ;
 31994                                  ;	$WAIT
 31995                                  ;	$EXEC
 31996                                  ;	$Keep_process
 31997                                  ;	Stay_resident
 31998                                  ;	$EXIT
 31999                                  ;	$ABORT
 32000                                  ;	abort_inner
 32001                                  ;
 32002                                  ;	Modification history:
 32003                                  ;
 32004                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 32005                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 32006                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 32007                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 32008                                  ;
 32009                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 32010                                  ;
 32011                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 32012                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 32013                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 32014                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 32015                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 32016                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 32017                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 32018                                  ;
 32019                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 32020                                  ;
 32021                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 32022                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 32023                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 32024                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 32025                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 32026                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 32027                                  ;
 32028                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 32029                                  ;
 32030                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 32031                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 32032                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 32033                                  ;
 32034                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 32035                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 32036                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 32037                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 32038                                  ;
 32039                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 32040                                  ;
 32041                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 32042                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 32043                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 32044                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 32045                                  ;
 32046                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 32047                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 32048                                  ;		       UMBs.
 32049                                  ;
 32050                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 32051                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 32052                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 32053                                  ;
 32054                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 32055                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 32056                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 32057                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 32058                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 32059                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 32060                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 32061                                  ;

 32085                                  _$WAIT:
 32086                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32087                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 32088                                  
 32089 00005C3C 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX

 32093                                  ; =========================================================================
 32094                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 32095                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 32096                                  ;
 32097                                  ;
 32098                                  ; Assembler usage:
 32099                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 32100                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 32101                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 32102                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 32103                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 32104                                  ;
 32105                                  ;	AL  Function
 32106                                  ;	--  --------
 32107                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 32108                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 32109                                  ;	    begin execution.
 32110                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 32111                                  ;
 32112                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 32113                                  ;
 32114                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32115                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32116                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32117                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32118                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32119                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32120                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32121                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32122                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32123                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32124                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32125                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32126                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32127                                  ;
 32128                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 32129                                  ;
 32130                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32131                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32132                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32133                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32134                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32135                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32136                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32137                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32138                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32139                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32140                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32141                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32142                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32143                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32144                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 32145                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32146                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32147                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 32148                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32149                                  ;
 32150                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 32151                                  ;
 32152                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32153                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 32154                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 32155                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32156                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 32157                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 32158                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32159                                  ;
 32160                                  ; Returns:
 32161                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 32162                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 32163                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 32164                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 32165                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 32166                                  ; =========================================================================
 32167                                  ;
 32168                                  ;   Revision history:
 32169                                  ;
 32170                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 32171                                  ;
 32172                                  ; =========================================================================
 32173                                  
 32174                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 32175                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)

 32200                                  	
 32201                                  _$EXEC:
 32202                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32203                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 32204                                  
 32205                                  EXEC001S:
 32206                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 32207                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 32208                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 32209                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 32210                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 32211                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 32212                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 32213                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 32214                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 32215                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD

 32217                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 32218                                  	;
 32219                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 32220                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 32221                                  
 32222                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32223                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 32224                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 32225                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 32226                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 32227                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 32228                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 32229                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 32230                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 32231                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 32232                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 32233                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 32234                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 32235                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 32236                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 32237                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 32238                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 32239                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 32240                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 32241                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32242                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]

 32244                                  	
 32245                                  	; ==================================================================
 32246                                  	; validate function
 32247                                  	; ==================================================================
 32248                                  		      	
 32249                                  	; M068 - Start
 32250                                  	;
 32251                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 32252                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 32253                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 32254                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 32255                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 32256                                  
 32257                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32258 00005C46 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 32259                                  
 32260                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 32261                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 32262                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 32263                                  
 32264 00005C4C 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 32265                                  	;jne	short @f
 32266 00005C4E 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 32267                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 32268 00005C50 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 32269 00005C51 B9[4C04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 32270 00005C54 51                      	push	cx
 32271                                  ;@@:
 32272                                  Exec_@f:
 32273                                  	; M068 - End
 32274                                  	
 32275                                  	;Enter
 32276                                  
 32277 00005C55 55                      	push	bp
 32278 00005C56 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 32279                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 32280                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 32281                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 32282                                  	; 17/12/2022
 32283                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32284 00005C58 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 32285                                  
 32286                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32287 00005C5B 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 32288                                  					; M030
 32289 00005C5D 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32290                                  
 32291                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32292                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 32293                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32294                                  
 32295                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 32296 00005C5F 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 32297                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 32298                                  	;mov	al,1
 32299 00005C65 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 32300                                  
 32301                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 32302                                  	;Leave
 32303 00005C67 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 32304 00005C69 5D                      	pop	bp
 32305                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 32306 00005C6A E920AA                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 32307                                  
 32308                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32309                                  ExecReadyJ:
 32310 00005C6D E80318                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 32311 00005C70 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 32312                                  
 32313                                  Exec_Check_2:
 32314 00005C73 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 32315 00005C75 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 32316                                  
 32317                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32318 00005C77 3C04                    	cmp	al,4			; 2 & 4 are not allowed
 32319 00005C79 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun

 33220 00006047 E8D601                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 33221                                  ;SR;
 33222                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 33223                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 33224                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 33225                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 33226                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 33227                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 33228                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 33229                                  ;call is issued.
 33230

 33749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33750                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 33751                                  ;
 33752                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 33753                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 33754                                  ;
 33755                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 33756                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 33757                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 33758                                  ;
 33759                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33760                                  
 33761                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 33769                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3

 33771 00006273 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 33772 00006278 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 33773 0000627B 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 33774

 33783 00006288 5B                      	pop	BX

 33785

 33998                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 33999                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34000                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 34001                                  ;
 34002                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 34003                                  ;	EXIT	none
 34004                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 34005                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34006                                  
 34007                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34008                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 34010                                  arena_free_process:
 34011                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34012                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34013 000062F3 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 34014                                  arena_free_process_start:
 34015 000062F7 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 34016                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 34017 000062FA E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 34018                                  
 34019                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 34020                                          ;retc
 34021 000062FD 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34022 000062FF 06                      	PUSH    ES
 34023 00006300 1F                              POP     DS
 34024                                  	;cmp	[1],bx 
 34025 00006301 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 34026 00006305 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 34027                                  	;mov	[1],di

 34029

 34032 0000630B 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34033                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 34034                                          ;retz				; never come back no more
 34035                                  	;JZ	SHORT AFP_RETN  ; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 2.11)
 34036                                  	; 14/05/2019
 34037                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34038 0000630E 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 34039                                          
 34040 00006310 E81300                  	CALL    arena_next              ; next item in ES/AX carry set if trash
 34041 00006313 EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 34042

 34044                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start
 34045                                  	; 20/05/2019
 34046 00006315 36A1[8C00]              	mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]	; ax = umb_head
 34047 00006319 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh		; Q: is umb_head initialized
 34048 0000631C 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 34049

 34051 00006320 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; Q: is last arena above umb_head
 34052 00006322 7318                    	jae	short ret_label		; Y: we've scanned umbs also. done.
 34053 00006324 EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 34054                                  					; M010 - End

 34060                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 34061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34062                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 34063                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34064                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 34065                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 34066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34067                                  
 34068                                  arena_next:
 34069 00006326 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 34070 00006328 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 34071 0000632C 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 34072                                  
 34073                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 34074                                  ;
 34075                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 34076                                  ;       RETN
 34077                                  
 34078                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 34079                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34080                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 34081                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34082                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 34083                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 34084                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 34085                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 34086                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34087                                  
 34088                                  check_signature:        
 34089                                  
 34090 0000632D 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 34091                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 34092 0000632F 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 34093                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 34094 00006333 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34095                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34096 00006335 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 34097                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 34098 00006339 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34099 0000633B F9                              STC                             ; set error
 34100                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 34101                                  AFP_RETN:
 34102                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34103                                  check_signature_ok:
 34104                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 34105 0000633C C3                      	RETN
 34106                                  
 34107                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 34108                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34109                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 34110                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 34111                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 34112                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 34113                                  ;
 34114                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 34115                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34116                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34117                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 34118                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 34119                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 34120                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 34121                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34122                                          
 34123                                  Coalesce:
 34124                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34125 0000633D 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34126                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 34127                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 34128 00006340 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 34129 00006342 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 34130                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 34131 00006345 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 34132                                  
 34133                                  coalesce_check:
 34134                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 34135 00006347 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 34136                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 34137 0000634C 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 34138                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 34139 0000634E 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 34140 00006353 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 34141                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 34142 00006354 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 34143 00006358 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 34144 0000635B 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 34145 0000635D EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 34146                                  
 34147                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34148                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 34149                                  
 34150                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 34151                                  
 34152                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34153                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34154                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 34155                                  ;
 34156                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 34157                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 34158                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 34159                                  ;
 34160                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 34161                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 34162                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 34163                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 34164                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 34165                                  ;
 34166                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 34167                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 34168                                  ;
 34169                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34170                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34171                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34172                                  ;           INT     21h
 34173                                  ;
 34174                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 34175                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 34176                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 34177                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 34178                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 34179                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 34180                                  ;
 34181                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 34182                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 34183                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 34184                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 34185                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 34186                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 34187                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 34188                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 34189                                  ;	USES	All
 34190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34191                                  
 34192                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34194                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 34195                                  ;
 34196                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34197                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34198                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34199                                  ;           INT     21h

 34527                                  
 34528                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34529                                  
 34530                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34531                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34532                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 34533                                  ;
 34534                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 34535                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 34536                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 34537                                  ;
 34538                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 34539                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 34540                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 34541                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 34542                                  ;
 34543                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 34544                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 34545                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 34546                                  ;		code.
 34547                                  ;
 34548                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 34549                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 34550                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 34551                                  ;
 34552                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34553                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34554                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 34555                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 34556                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 34557                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 34558                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 34559                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34561                                  
 34562                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34564                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34565                                  ;
 34566                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34567                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 34568                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 34569                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 34570                                  ;           INT     21h
 34571                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 34572                                  ;         size possible
 34573                                  ;   Error return:
 34574                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 34575                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 34576                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 34577                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 34578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34579                                  
 34580                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 34581                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34582                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 34583 000064B5 E8D0AE                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34584

 34587 000064BD 48                              DEC     AX

 34609                                  ;

 34663 00006507 E899AE                  	call    LCritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34664                                          ;error	error_invalid_block
 34665                                  	;mov	al,9
 34666 0000650A B009                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_block
 34667                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34668                                  dealloc_errj:
 34669                                  AllocOperErrj:	; 17/12/2022
 34670 0000650C E97EA1                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 34671                                  
 34672                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34673                                  
 34674                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34675                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34676                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 34677                                  ;
 34678                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34679                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34680                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34681                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34682                                  ;           INT     21h
 34683                                  ;
 34684                                  ;	ENTRY	
 34685                                  ;		(al) = 0
 34686                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 34687                                  ;
 34688                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 34689                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 34690                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 34691                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 34692                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 34693                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 34694                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 34695                                  ;
 34696                                  ;		(al) = 2
 34697                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 34698                                  ;
 34699                                  ;		(al) = 3
 34700                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 34701                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 34702                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 34703                                  ;
 34704                                  ;
 34705                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34706                                  ;
 34707                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 34708                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 34709                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 34710                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 34711                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 34712                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 34713                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 34714                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 34715                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 34716                                  ;
 34717                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34718                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 34719                                  ;
 34720                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 34721                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 34722                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 34723                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 34724                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 34725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34726                                  
 34727                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34729                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34730                                  ;
 34731                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34732                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34733                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34734                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34735                                  ;           INT     21h
 34736                                  ;
 34737                                  ;   Error return:
 34738                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 34739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34740                                  
 34741                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34742                                  _$ALLOCOPER:
 34743                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34744                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 34746 00006511 741E                    	jz	short AllocGetStrat

 34754                                  	;ja	short AllocSetLink
 34755                                  	;;jmp	short AllocGetLink

 34759                                  	;and 	al,LINKSTATE		
 34760                                  	;;transfer SYS_RET_OK
 34761                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 34762

 34905                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34906                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34907                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 34908                                  ;
 34909                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 34910                                  ;
 34911                                  ;
 34912                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 34913                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 34914                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 34915                                  ;		   else
 34916                                  ;			DS = last arena
 34917                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 34918                                  ;
 34919                                  ;		   CY if error
 34920                                  ;
 34921                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 34922                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34923                                  
 34924                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34925                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34926                                  
 34927                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34928                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34929                                  	
 34930                                  GetLastArena:
 34931 0000659A 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 34932                                  
 34933 0000659B 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 34934 0000659F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 34935 000065A1 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 34936                                  
 34937 000065A3 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34938                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34939 000065A7 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 34940                                  					
 34941                                  GLA_next:
 34942 000065A9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34943 000065AB E878FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34944                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34945                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34946                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34947 000065AE 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34948                                  
 34949 000065B0 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34950 000065B6 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 34951                                  					;    umb_head
 34952                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 34953                                  
 34954 000065B8 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34955                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34956 000065BC EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 34957                                  GLA_chkumb:
 34958 000065BE 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34959                                  GLA_@f:
 34960 000065C0 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 34961                                  
 34962                                  GLA_done:
 34963                                  					; M061 - Start
 34964 000065C2 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34965 000065C8 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 34966                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 34967                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 34968 000065CA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34969 000065CC E857FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34970                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34971 000065CF 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34972 000065D1 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34973 000065D3 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 34974                                  					; M061 - End
 34975                                  GLA_ret:
 34976                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 34977                                  	;clc
 34978                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34979                                  	;clc
 34980 000065D5 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 34981 000065D6 C3                      	retn				; M061
 34982                                  
 34983                                  GLA_err:
 34984 000065D7 F9                      	stc				; M061
 34985                                  GLA_err2:
 34986 000065D8 58                      	pop	ax
 34987 000065D9 C3                      	retn

 35016                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 35017                                  
 35018                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35019                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35020                                  
 35021                                  ;hkn; TABLE	SEGMENT
 35022                                  ;Public SRVC001S,SRVC001E
 35023                                  ;SRVC001S label byte
 35024                                  
 35025                                  SRVC001S:
 35026                                  
 35027 000065DA [DE65]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 35028 000065DC [3066]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 35029 000065DE 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 35030 000065DF [9866]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 35031 000065E1 [3166]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 35032 000065E3 [6766]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 35033 000065E5 [7266]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 35034 000065E7 [7966]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 35035 000065E9 [8066]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5
 35036 000065EB [D966]                  		dw	GET_DOS_DATA	; 6
 35037 000065ED [FD66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 7
 35038 000065EF [FD66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 8
 35039 000065F1 [FD66]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 9
 35040 000065F3 [0967]                  		dw	_$SetExtendedError  ; 10
 35041

 35043                                  
 35044                                  ;SRVC001E label byte
 35045                                  
 35046                                  SRVC001E:
 35047                                  
 35048                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 35049                                  
 35050                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35051                                  ;
 35052                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 35053                                  ;
 35054                                  ; Inputs:
 35055                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 35056                                  ; Function:
 35057                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 35058                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 35059                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 35060                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 35061                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 35062                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 35063                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 35064                                  ;			CX User Index
 35065                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 35066                                  ;			BX = UID
 35067                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 35068                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 35069                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 35070                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 35071                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 35072                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 35073                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 35074                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 35075                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 35076                                  ;
 35077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35078                                  
 35079                                  _$ServerCall:
 35080                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35081                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 35082                                  	; 10/06/2019
 35083                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35084                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 35085                                  
 35086                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35087                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 35088 000065F5 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 35089 000065F7 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 35090 000065F9 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 35091 000065FB 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 35092                                  SET_STUFF:
 35093 000065FD 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point to DPL with DS:SI
 35094                                  	;mov	bx,[si+12h]
 35095 000065FF 8B5C12                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.UID]
 35096                                  
 35097                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35098                                  ;SR;
 35099                                  ; WIN386 updates the USER_ID itself. If WIN386 is present we skip the updating
 35100                                  ; of USER_ID
 35101                                  
 35102 00006602 36F606[3010]01          	test	byte [SS:IsWin386],1
 35103 00006608 7505                    	jnz	short skip_win386
 35104                                  
 35105                                  ;hkn; SS override for user_id and proc_id
 35106                                  	; 15/08/2018
 35107 0000660A 36891E[3E03]            	MOV	[SS:USER_ID],BX		; Set UID
 35108                                  
 35109                                  skip_win386:
 35110 0000660F 8B5C14                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.PID]
 35111 00006612 36891E[3C03]            	MOV	[SS:PROC_ID],BX		; Set process ID
 35112                                  NO_SET_ID:
 35113                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35114 00006617 2EFF36[DC65]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 35115 0000661C 2EFF36[DA65]            	PUSH	word [cS:SERVERTAB]	; push table address
 35116 00006621 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35117 00006622 E873AC                  	call	TableDispatch
 35118                                  
 35119                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35120                                  	;mov 	byte [SS:EXETERR_LOCUS],1
 35121 00006625 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; Extended Error Locus
 35122                                  	;error	error_invalid_function
 35123                                  	;mov	al,1
 35124 0000662B B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 35125                                  servercall_error:
 35126 0000662D E95DA0                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 35127                                  
 35128                                  SERVERRETURN:
 35129 00006630 C3                      	retn
 35130                                  
 35131                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 35132                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 35133                                  
 35134                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35135                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 35136 00006631 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			;   for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 35137 00006633 16                      	push	ss
 35138 00006634 1F                      	pop	ds
 35139 00006635 E850AD                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 35140                                  CommitLoop:
 35141 00006638 53                      	push	bx
 35142 00006639 E82401                  	call	SFFromSFN
 35143 0000663C 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone
 35144 0000663E 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 35145                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 35146                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 35147 00006642 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext
 35148                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35149 00006644 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35150                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],sf_busy  
 35151                                  					; BUSY SFTs have god knows what
 35152 00006648 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.
 35153                                  	; 17/12/2022
