 35391                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 35392                                  
 35393                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 35394                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35395                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 35396                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 35397                                  ;
 35398                                  ;	NOTE:
 35399                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35400                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35401                                  ;
 35402                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35403                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 35404                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 35405                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35406                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 35407                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 35408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35409                                  
 35410                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35411                                  
 35412                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 35413                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35414                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35415 0000672D 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35416                                  	
 35417                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 35418 00006732 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 35419                                  
 35420                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 35421 00006737 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 35422 0000673C 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 35423                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35424                                  	;mov	al,6
 35425 0000673E B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35426                                  ReturnCarry:
 35427 00006740 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 35428 00006741 C3                      	retn				; go back
 35429                                  pjfn10: 
 35430                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 35431 00006742 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 35432 00006747 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 35433                                  	;clc
 35434                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 35435 00006749 C3                      	retn
 35436                                  
 35437                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 35438                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35439                                  ;
 35440                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 35441                                  ;
 35442                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 35443                                  ;
 35444                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 35445                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 35446                                  ;                   AX has error code
 35447                                  ;               Carry Reset
 35448                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 35449                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 35450                                  ; NOTE:
 35451                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35452                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35453                                  ;
 35454                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35455                                  
 35456                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35457                                  
 35458                                  SFFromHandle:
 35459 0000674A E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 35460                                  	;retc				; return if error
 35461 0000674D 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 35462 0000674F 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 35463                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35464                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35465                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35466                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35467                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35468                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35469 00006753 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 35470                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35471                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35472                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35473                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35474                                  GetSF:
 35475 00006755 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 35476 00006756 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 35477 00006759 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 35478 0000675B E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 35479 0000675E 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 35480 0000675F C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 35481                                  
 35482                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 35483                                  
 35484                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 35485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35486                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 35487                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 35488                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 35489                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 35490                                  ;
 35491                                  ;   NOTE:
 35492                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 35493                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35494                                  ;
 35495                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 35496                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35497                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 35498                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 35499                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 35500                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35501                                  
 35502                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35503                                  
 35504                                  SFFromSFN:
 35505                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35506                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35507 00006760 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35508                                  
 35509                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 35510 00006765 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 35511                                  sfsfn5:	
 35512                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 35513 0000676A 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 35514 0000676E 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 35515                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 35516 00006770 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 35517 00006774 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 35518                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 35519 00006777 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 35520 0000677A 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 35521 0000677C F9                      	STC
 35522 0000677D C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 35523                                  sfsfn7:
 35524 0000677E 50                      	push	ax
 35525                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 35526                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35527                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 35528                                  	
 35529                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35530 0000677F B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 35531                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35532                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 35533                                  	
 35534 00006781 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 35535 00006783 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 35536 00006785 58                      	pop	ax
 35537                                  	;add	di,6
 35538 00006786 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 35539 00006789 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 35540                                  
 35541                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 35542                                  
 35543                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 35544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35545                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 35546                                  ;
 35547                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35548                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35549                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 35550                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 35551                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35552                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35553                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 35554                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35555                                  
 35556                                  JFNFree:
 35557 0000678A 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 35558                                  jfnf1:	
 35559 0000678C E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 35560 0000678F 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 35561 00006791 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 35562 00006795 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 35563 00006797 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 35564 00006798 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 35565                                  
 35566                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 35567                                  jfnf5:	
 35568                                  	;mov	al,4
 35569 0000679A B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 35570                                  jfnfx:	
 35571 0000679C C3                      	retn				; bye
 35572                                  
 35573                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 35574                                  
 35575                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 35576                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35577                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 35578                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35579                                  ;
 35580                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 35581                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 35582                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 35583                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 35584                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 35585                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 35586                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 35587                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 35588                                  ;
 35589                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 35590                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 35591                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 35592                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 35593                                  ;
 35594                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35595                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 35596                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 35597                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 35598                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35599                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35600                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35601                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 35602                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35603                                  
 35604                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35605                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35606                                  
 35607                                  SFNFree:
 35608                                  	; 12/08/2018
 35609                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35610                                  	;
 35611                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35612 0000679D 50                      	push	ax
 35613 0000679E 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 35614                                  sfnf5:	
 35615 000067A0 53                      	push	bx
 35616 000067A1 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 35617 000067A4 5B                      	pop	bx
 35618 000067A5 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 35619 000067A7 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 35620                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 35621 000067AB 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 35622                                  	
 35623                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35624 000067AD 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35625                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 35626 000067B1 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 35627                                  sfnf7:

 35697                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 35698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35699                                  ;
 35700                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 35701                                  ;
 35702                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 35703                                  ;		path
 35704                                  ;
 35705                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35706                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 35707                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 35708                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 35709                                  ;
 35710                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35711                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 35712                                  ;	USES	all
 35713                                  ;
 35714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35715                                  
 35716                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35717                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35718                                  
 35719                                  _$CLOSE:
 35720                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 35721                                  
 35722 000067E5 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 35723 000067E8 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 35724 000067EA 16                      	push	ss
 35725 000067EB 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 35726 000067EC 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 35727 000067F0 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 35728                                  
 35729                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 35730                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 35731                                  ;
 35732                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 35733                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 35734                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 35735                                  
 35736                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 35737 000067F4 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 35738 000067F8 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 35739                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 35740 000067FA 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 35741                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 35742 000067FE 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 35743                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 35744 00006800 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 35745 00006802 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 35746                                  
 35747                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 35748                                  ; -1.
 35749                                  
 35750                                  FreeJFN:
 35751 00006804 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 35752 00006807 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 35753                                  PostFree:
 35754                                  
 35755                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 35756                                  
 35757 0000680B E888C7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 35758                                  
 35759                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 35760                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 35761                                  
 35762 0000680E 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 35763                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 35764 00006810 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 35765                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35766                                  CloseOk:
 35767 00006812 E96F9E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 35768                                  CloseError:
 35769 00006815 E9759E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 35770

 35999                                  ;	BREAK <$READ - Read from a file handle>
 36000                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36001                                  ;
 36002                                  ;**	$Read - Read from a File Handle
 36003                                  ;
 36004                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 36005                                  ;
 36006                                  ;	LDS	DX, buf
 36007                                  ;	MOV	CX, count
 36008                                  ;	MOV	BX, handle
 36009                                  ;	MOV	AH, Read
 36010                                  ;	INT	int_command
 36011                                  ;	  AX has number of bytes read
 36012                                  ;
 36013                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = file handle
 36014                                  ;		(cx) = byte count
 36015                                  ;		(ds:dx) = buffer address
 36016                                  ;	EXIT	Through system call return so that to user:
 36017                                  ;		  'C' clear if OK
 36018                                  ;		    (ax) = bytes read
 36019                                  ;		  'C' set if error
 36020                                  ;		    (ax) = error code

 36033

 36035

 36512                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 36513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36514                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 36515                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 36516                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 36517                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 36518                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 36519                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 36520                                  ;
 36521                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 36522                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 36523                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 36524                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 36525                                  ;	USES	none
 36526                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36527                                  
 36528                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36529                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36530                                  CheckOwner:
 36531                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36532                                  
 36533 00006A42 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 36534 00006A45 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 36535                                  
 36536 00006A47 50                      	push	ax
 36537                                  
 36538                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36539                                  
 36540                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 36541                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 36550                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 36551 00006A58 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]

 36570                                  ;============================================================================
 36571                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36572                                  ;============================================================================
 36573                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 36574                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36575                                  
 36576                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 36577                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 36578                                  
 36579                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 36580                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 36581                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 36582                                  
 36583                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 36584                                  ;
 36585                                  ;	$AssignOper
 36586                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 36587                                  ;	InitCDS
 36588                                  ;	$UserOper
 36589                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 36590                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 36591                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 36592                                  ;
 36593                                  ;   Revision history:
 36594                                  ;
 36595                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 36596                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 36597                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 36598                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 36599                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 36600                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 36601                                  ;				    aliasing.
 36602                                  ;
 36603                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 36604                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 36605                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 36606                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 36607                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 36608                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 36609                                  ;
 36610                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 36611                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 36612                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 36613                                  ;
 36614                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 36615                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 36616                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 36617                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 36618                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 36619                                  ;
 36620                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 36621                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 36622                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 36623                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 36624                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 36625                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 36626                                  ;
 36627                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 36628                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 36629                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 36630                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 36631                                  ;   number.
 36632                                  ;
 36633                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 36634                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 36635                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 36636                                  ;   TransPath.
 36637                                  ;
 36638                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 36639                                  
 36640                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 36641                                  
 36642                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 36643                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 36644                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 36645                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 36646                                  ;					; current drive)
 36647                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 36648                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 36649                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 36650                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 36651                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 36652                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 36653                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 36654                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 36655                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 36656                                  
 36657                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 36658                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36659                                  ; Inputs:
 36660                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 36661                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 36662                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 36663                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 36664                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 36665                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 36666                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 36667                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 36668                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 36669                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 36670                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36671                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 36672                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 36673                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36674                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 36675                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 36676                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 36677                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 36678                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 36679                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 36680                                  ; Function:
 36681                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 36682                                  ; Returns:
 36683                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 36684                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36685                                  
 36686                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36687                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36692                                  srinuse:								;AN000;

 36698                                  	;cmp	word [si+45h],0
 36699 00006A70 837C4500                	CMP	WORD [SI+curdir.devptr],0     ; dpb ptr =0 ?		;AN000;

 36709                                  resetdrv:

 36756                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 36757                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36758                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 36759                                  ;
 36760                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 36761                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 36762                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 36763                                  ;		'C' clear
 36764                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 36765                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags
 36766                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36767                                  
 36768                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36769                                  FIND_DPB:
 36770 00006A9C 36C536[2600]            	LDS	SI,[SS:DPBHEAD]		;smr;SS Override
 36771                                  fdpb5:	
 36772 00006AA1 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1
 36773 00006AA4 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 36774 00006AA6 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]
 36775                                  	;CMP	AL,[SI+DPB.DRIVE]
 36776 00006AA8 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 36777                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 36778                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36779 00006AAA C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 36780 00006AAD EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5
 36781                                  fdpb10:	
 36782 00006AAF F9                      	STC
 36783                                  ret_label15:

 36793                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS

 36853                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 36854                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36855                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 36856                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 36857                                  ;
 36858                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 36859                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 36860                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 36861                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 36862                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 36863                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 36864                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 36865                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 36866                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 36867                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 36868                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 36869                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36870                                  
 36871                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36872                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36873                                  _$UserOper:
 36874                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36875                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 36876 00006AFE 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36877 00006AFF 2C01                    	SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 36878 00006B01 58                      	POP	AX
 36879 00006B02 7211                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 36880 00006B04 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 36881 00006B06 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 36882 00006B08 763D                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 36883                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 36884 00006B0A 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 36885                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 36886                                  	;error	error_invalid_function	; not 0,1,2,3
 36887                                  	;mov	al,1
 36888 00006B10 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 36889                                  useroper_error:
 36890                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36891                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36892 00006B12 E9789B                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 36893                                  	;jmp	short ASS_ERR
 36894                                  
 36895                                  UserGet:
 36896                                  ; Transfer MYNAME to DS:DX
 36897                                  ; Set Return CX to MYNUM
 36898 00006B15 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; switch registers
 36899 00006B16 07                      	POP	ES
 36900 00006B17 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX			; destination
 36901 00006B19 368B0E[0E00]            	MOV	CX,[SS:MYNUM]		; Get number	;smr;SS Override
 36902 00006B1E E8A999                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 36903                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
 36904 00006B21 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX ; Set number return
 36905 00006B24 16                      	push	ss			; point to DOSDATA
 36906 00006B25 1F                      	pop	ds
 36907 00006B26 BE[0503]                	MOV	SI,MYNAME		; point source to user string
 36908                                  UserMove:
 36909 00006B29 B90F00                  	MOV	CX,15
 36910 00006B2C F3A4                    	REP	MOVSB			; blam.
 36911 00006B2E 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; 16th byte is 0
 36912 00006B30 AA                      	STOSB
 36913                                  UserBye:
 36914 00006B31 E9509B                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; no errors here

 36917                                  ; Transfer DS:DX to MYNAME
 36918                                  ; CX to MYNUM
 36919 00006B34 36890E[0E00]            	MOV	[SS:MYNUM],CX				;smr;SS Override
 36920 00006B39 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; user space has source
 36921 00006B3B 16                      	push	ss
 36922 00006B3C 07                      	pop	es
 36923 00006B3D BF[0503]                	MOV	DI,MYNAME		; point dest to user string
 36924 00006B40 36FE06[0403]            	INC	byte [SS:DIFFNAM]	; signal change ;smr;SS Override
 36925 00006B45 EBE2                    	JMP	short UserMove

 36937                                  			; STACK: WORD function

 36996                                  ;   GetThisDrv - look through a set of macros and return the current drive and

 37077                                  ;Break <GetCDSFromDrv - convert a drive number to a CDS pointer>
 37078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37079                                  ;   GetCDSFromDrv - given a physical drive number, convert it to a CDS
 37080                                  ;	pointer, returning an error if the drive number is greater than the
 37081                                  ;	number of CDS's
 37082                                  ;
 37083                                  ;   Inputs:	AL is physical unit # A=0...
 37084                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set if Bad Drive
 37085                                  ;		Carry Clear
 37086                                  ;		    DS:SI -> CDS
 37087                                  ;		    [THISCDS] = DS:SI
 37088                                  ;   Registers modified: DS,SI

 37092                                  GetCDSFromDrv:

 37095 00006BCA F9                      	STC				; signal error
 37096 00006BCB C3                      	RETN				; bye

 37099 00006BCD 50                      	PUSH	AX

 37101                                  	;mov	bl,81 ; MSDOS 3.3
 37102                                  	;mov	bl,88 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 37103 00006BD3 B358                    	MOV	BL,curdir.size		; size in convenient spot
 37104 00006BD5 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; get net offset
 37105 00006BD7 01C6                    	ADD	SI,AX			; convert to true pointer
 37106 00006BD9 368936[A205]            	MOV	[SS:THISCDS],SI		; store convenient offset;smr;SS Override
 37107 00006BDE 368C1E[A405]            	MOV	[SS:THISCDS+2],DS	; store convenient segment;smr;SS Override

 37109 00006BE4 5B                      	POP	BX
 37110 00006BE5 F8                      	CLC				; no error
 37111 00006BE6 C3                      	RETN				; bye!

 37119                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 37120                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37121                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 37122                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 37123                                  ;
 37124                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 37125                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 37126                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 37127                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 37128                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 37129                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 37130                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37131                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37132                                  
 37133                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37134                                  TransFCB:
 37135                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37136                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37137                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 37138                                  	;ENTER
 37139 00006BE7 55                      	push	bp
 37140 00006BE8 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37141                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 37142 00006BEA 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 37143 00006BED 16                      	push	ss
 37144 00006BEE 07                      	pop	es
 37145 00006BEF 06                      	push	es
 37146 00006BF0 57                      	push	di
 37147                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37148                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 37149 00006BF1 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 37150 00006BF4 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 37151 00006BFA 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37152 00006C00 E8DFB0                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 37153                                  	; 06/12/2022
 37154 00006C03 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 37155 00006C05 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 37156 00006C08 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37157 00006C0C 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 37158                                  GetDrive:
 37159 00006C12 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 37160 00006C13 E858FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 37161 00006C16 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 37162 00006C18 E87403                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 37163                                  
 37164                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 37165                                  
 37166                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 37167 00006C1B B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 37168 00006C1E 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 37169                                  FCBScan:
 37170 00006C1F AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 37171                                  	
 37172                                  	; 09/08/2018
 37173                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 37174                                  	;es	xlat
 37175                                  
 37176                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 37177 00006C20 E81CE5                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 37178                                  
 37179                                  	;test	al,8	
 37180 00006C23 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 37181 00006C25 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 37182                                  NextCh: 
 37183 00006C27 E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 37184 00006C29 5E                      	pop	si
 37185 00006C2A 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 37186 00006C2C E80BB5                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 37187 00006C2F 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 37188 00006C30 07                      	pop	es
 37189 00006C31 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 37190 00006C32 1F                      	pop	ds
 37191                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37192                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 37193 00006C33 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 37194 00006C36 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 37195 00006C39 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 37196 00006C3B 55                      	push	bp
 37197 00006C3C E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 37198 00006C3F 5D                      	pop	bp
 37199 00006C40 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 37200                                  BadPack:
 37201 00006C42 F9                      	STC
 37202                                  	;mov	al,3
 37203 00006C43 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 37204                                  FCBRet: 
 37205                                  	;LEAVE
 37206 00006C45 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 37207 00006C47 5D                      	pop	bp
 37208                                  TransPath_retn:
 37209 00006C48 C3                      	retn

 37213                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 37214                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37215                                  ;
 37216                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 37217                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 37218                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 37219                                  ;       exactly.
 37220                                  ;
 37221                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 37222                                  ;       matches splice.
 37223                                  ;
 37224                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 37225                                  ;
 37226                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 37227                                  ;
 37228                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 37229                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 37230                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 37231                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 37232                                  ;
 37233                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 37234                                  ;
 37235                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 37236                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 37237                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 37238                                  ;
 37239                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 37240                                  ;
 37241                                  ;       if fSharing then
 37242                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37243                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37244                                  ;           splice
 37245                                  ;           fatRead
 37246                                  ;           return
 37247                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 37248                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 37249                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37250                                  ;           return
 37251                                  ;       if device then
 37252                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37253                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37254                                  ;           return
 37255                                  ;       if file then
 37256                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 37257                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 37258                                  ;           Copy current dir
 37259                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 37260                                  ;           splice
 37261                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 37262                                  ;           if local then
 37263                                  ;               fatread
 37264                                  ;           return
 37265                                  ;
 37266                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37267                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 37268                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37269                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 37270                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 37271                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 37272                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 37273                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37274                                  ;
 37275                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37276                                  
 37277                                  ; 22/05/2019
 37278                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37279                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37280                                  
 37281                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37282                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37283                                  
 37284                                  TransPath:
 37285 00006C49 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 37286 00006C4B EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 37287                                  TransPathSet:
 37288 00006C4D B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37289                                  SetSplice:
 37290 00006C4F 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 37291 00006C53 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37292                                  TransPathNoSet:
 37293 00006C55 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		;   fSplice = TRUE;     ;smr;SS Override
 37294 00006C59 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 37295 00006C5F 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 37296 00006C64 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 37297 00006C6B 16                      	push	ss
 37298 00006C6C 07                      	pop	es
 37299                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 37300 00006C6D 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 37301                                  ;
 37302                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 37303                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 37304                                  ;
 37305 00006C71 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 37306 00006C77 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 37307                                  ;
 37308                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 37309                                  ;
 37310 00006C79 E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 37311 00006C7C E8EFFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 37312 00006C7F 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 37313 00006C81 E80B03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 37314 00006C84 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 37315 00006C87 E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 37316 00006C8A 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 37317                                  ;
 37318                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 37319                                  ;
 37320 00006C8C 16                      	push	ss
 37321 00006C8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 37322 00006C8E 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 37323 00006C92 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 37324 00006C97 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 37325 00006C99 E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 37326                                  NoServerSplice:
 37327 00006C9C 16                      	push	ss
 37328 00006C9D 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 37329 00006C9E C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 37330 00006CA2 E8E3A6                  	call	ECritDisk
 37331 00006CA5 E80AEB                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 37332 00006CA8 E8F8A6                  	call	LCritDisk
 37333                                  NoPath:
 37334                                  	;mov	al,3
 37335 00006CAB B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37336 00006CAD C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 37337                                  
 37338                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 37339                                  ; the name if so.
 37340                                  
 37341                                  CheckUNC:
 37342 00006CAE 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 37343                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 37344 00006CB5 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 37345 00006CB8 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 37346                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 37347                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 37348                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 37349 00006CBA 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 37350                                  
 37351                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 37352                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 37353                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 37354                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 37355                                  
 37356                                  NO_CHECK:
 37357 00006CBC E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 37358 00006CBF 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 37359 00006CC0 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 37360 00006CC2 E897E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37361 00006CC5 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 37362 00006CC7 E892E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37363 00006CCA 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 37364 00006CCC 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 37365 00006CCE 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 37366                                  
 37367                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 37368                                  ; local machine root path
 37369                                  
 37370 00006CD0 58                      	POP     AX
 37371 00006CD1 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 37372                                  UNCCpy:
 37373 00006CD2 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 37374 00006CD3 E831E4                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 37375 00006CD6 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 37376 00006CD8 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 37377 00006CDA E87FE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 37378 00006CDD 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 37379 00006CDF AA                      	STOSB
 37380 00006CE0 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 37381 00006CE2 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 37382                                  UNCDone:
 37383 00006CE5 16                      	push	ss
 37384 00006CE6 1F                      	pop	ds
 37385 00006CE7 C3                       	retn				; return error code
 37386                                  UNCTerm:
 37387 00006CE8 AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 37388 00006CE9 EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 37389                                  
 37390                                  CheckDevice:
 37391                                  
 37392                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 37393                                  
 37394 00006CEB 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 37395 00006CEC 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 37396 00006CEF 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 37397                                  	;mov	al,2 
 37398 00006CF1 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 37399 00006CF3 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 37400 00006CF4 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 37401                                  CheckPath:
 37402 00006CF5 50                      	push	ax
 37403 00006CF6 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 37404                                  
 37405                                  
 37406                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37407                                  %if 0
 37408                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37409                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 37410                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 37411                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 37412                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 37413                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 37414                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 37415                                  ;;;
 37416                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 37417                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 37418                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 37419                                  ;;;
 37420                                  ;;;More info:
 37421                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 37422                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 37423                                  ;;;
 37424                                  	call	no5Dshere
 37425                                  start5Dhack:
 37426                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 37427                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 37428                                  
 37429                                  %endif
 37430                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37431                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 37432 00006CF7 E8B8D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 37433                                  
 37434 00006CFA 5D                      	pop	bp
 37435 00006CFB 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 37436 00006CFC 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 37437                                  
 37438                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 37439                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 37440                                  ; call.
 37441

 37444 00006D07 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 37445                                  
 37446                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 37447                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 37448                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 37449                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 37450                                  ; a device.

 37459 00006D18 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 37460                                  DoFile_retn:
 37461 00006D19 C3                      	retn

 37463                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 37465

 37469                                  %endif

 37471                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 37472                                  
 37473                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.

 37514                                  					;AN000;

 37517                                  
 37518                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 37519                                  
 37520 00006D44 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 37521 00006D46 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 37522 00006D4A 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 37523 00006D4C AA                      	STOSB
 37524                                  
 37525                                  ; Now get original string.
 37526                                  
 37527                                  GetOrig:
 37528 00006D4D 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 37529 00006D4E 5E                      	pop	si
 37530 00006D4F 1F                      	pop	ds
 37531                                  
 37532                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 37533                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 37534                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 37536 00006D50 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 37537 00006D53 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char

 37540                                  ;
 37541                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 37542                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 37543                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 37544                                  ;
 37545 00006D59 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 37546                                  SkipPath:

 37555                                  ; for yucks.

 37559 00006D68 AA                      	STOSB
 37560                                  
 37561                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 37562                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 37563                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..

 37567                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 37568 00006D6C 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn

 37571                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in

 37591

 37626                                  
 37627                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 37628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37629                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 37630                                  ;
 37631                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37632                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 37633                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 37634                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 37635                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37636                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 37637                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 37638                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 37639                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 37640                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 37641                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37642                                  
 37643                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37644                                  
 37645                                  Canonicalize:
 37646                                  
 37647                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 37648                                  
 37649 00006DBE AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 37650 00006DBF E89AE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 37651 00006DC2 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 37652 00006DC4 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 37653 00006DC6 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 37654 00006DC8 AA                      	STOSB
 37655 00006DC9 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 37656                                  CanonDec:
 37657 00006DCB 4E                      	DEC     SI
 37658                                  
 37659                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 37660                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 37661                                  ; buffer.
 37662                                  
 37663                                  CanonLoop:
 37664                                  
 37665                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 37666                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 37667                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 37668

 37671 00006DD0 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 37672 00006DD2 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 37673 00006DD7 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 37674 00006DD9 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 37675 00006DDB AA                      	STOSB
 37676 00006DDC 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH

 37678 00006DDE AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 37679 00006DDF F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 37680 00006DE0 C3                      	retn
 37681                                  
 37682                                  CanonBad:

 37684                                  	;mov	al,3

 37689                                  PathEnc:
 37690 00006DEA F9                      	STC
 37691                                  CanonBad_retn:
 37692 00006DEB C3                      	retn
 37693                                  
 37694                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 37695                                  ; it to 8.3
 37696                                  
 37697                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 37698 00006DEC E85000                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 37699 00006DEF 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 37700                                  
 37701                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases.  These will be backed up.
 37702                                  
 37703                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 37704 00006DF1 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 37705 00006DF5 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1

 37708 00006DFC 750A                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 37709 00006DFE 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 37710                                  Skip1:

 37712                                  	;mov	al,3
 37713 00006E02 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37714 00006E04 72E5                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn
 37715 00006E06 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 37716                                  
 37717                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 37718

 37720 00006E08 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 37721                                  
 37722                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 37723                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 37724                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 37725

 37745 00006E20 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up

 37747                                  
 37748                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 37749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37750                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 37751                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 37752                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 37753                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 37754                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise
 37755                                  ;   Registers modified: AL
 37756                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37757

 37766 00006E29 E930E3                  	jmp	PATHCHRCMP
