 42458                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42459                                  ;
 42460                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 42461                                  ;
 42462                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 42463                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 42464                                  ;
 42465                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 42466                                  ;		   if AX =0
 42467                                  ;		      if first entry
 42468                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 42469                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 42470                                  ;		      else
 42471                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 42472                                  ;
 42473                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 42474                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES	
 42475                                  ;
 42476                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 42477                                  ;
 42478                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 42479                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42480                                  
 42481 00007B89 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 42482                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 42483                                  
 42484                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 42485                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 42486                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 42487                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 42488                                  
 42489                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 42490 00007B8A 1E                      	push	ds
 42491                                  
 42492 00007B8B 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42493                                  
 42494 00007B90 E8B500                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 42495                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 42496                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42497                                  	; cx = 0
 42498 00007B93 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 42499                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 42500 00007B95 756C                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 42501                                  
 42502                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42503 00007B97 2E380E[897B]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 42504                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this 
 42505 00007B9C 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 42506                                  					;    segment in ES
 42507                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub 
 42508 00007B9E 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 42509 00007BA0 E86D00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 42510 00007BA3 E8EC00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 42511                                  					; with those in the stub.
 42512                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42513                                  	; cx = 0
 42514                                  second_entry:
 42515 00007BA6 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 42516                                  
 42517                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 42518                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 42519 00007BA8 BF[6210]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 42520                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42521                                  	; cx = 0
 42522                                  	;mov	cx,9
 42523 00007BAB B109                    	mov	cl,9
 42524 00007BAD 1E                      	push	ds			
 42525 00007BAE 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 42526                                  
 42527                                  dosinttabloop:
 42528 00007BAF 83C702                  	add	di,2
 42529 00007BB2 AB                      	stosw
 42530 00007BB3 E2FA                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 42531                                  
 42532                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 42533                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 42534                                  
 42535                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 42536 00007BB5 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 42537 00007BB8 724E                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 42538                                  ;endif
 42539 00007BBA E8A2FF                  	call	check_XMM		; Y: set up the XMS entry point
 42540 00007BBD 7249                    	jc	short sr_done		; failed to set up XMS do not do
 42541                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 42542                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42543                                  	; cx = 0
 42544 00007BBF E84B01                  	call	patch_in_nops		; enable the stub to check A20 state
 42545                                  ; M021-
 42546                                  	;mov	byte [1211h],1
 42547 00007BC2 C606[1112]01            	mov	byte [DosHasHMA],1	; set flag telling DOS control of HMA 
 42548                                  				
 42549                                  					; set pointer to the routine that 
 42550                                  					; patches buggy exepacked code.
 42551                                  	;mov	[FixExePatch],offset DOSCODE:ExePatch
 42552 00007BC7 C706[1212][2676]        	mov	word [FixExePatch],ExePatch
 42553                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine 
 42554                                  					; M068: that detects copy protected
 42555                                  					; M068: apps
 42556                                  	;mov	[ChkCopyProt],offset DOSCODE:IsCopyProt
 42557 00007BCD C706[6100][2678]        	mov	word [ChkCopyProt],IsCopyProt
 42558                                  
 42559                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDF1h
 42560                                  
 42561                                  ;	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42562                                  ;
 42563                                  ;; M020 - begin
 42564                                  ;
 42565                                  ;	call	WhatCPUType
 42566                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 42567                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42568                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 42569                                  ;	;mov	[RationalPatchPtr],offset DOSCODE:RationalPatch

 42571                                  ;
 42572                                  ;; M020 - end
 42573                                  ;
 42574                                  ;	jmp	short sr_done
 42575                                  ;

 42577                                  ;	mov	ax,es
 42578                                  ;	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42579                                  ;					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42580                                  ;					; offsets as they have been already
 42581                                  ;					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42582                                  ;					; DOSINIT.

 42588                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42589                                  ;
 42590                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 42591                                  ;
 42592                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 42593                                  ;
 42594                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 42595                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 42596                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 42597                                  ;
 42598                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 42599                                  ;
 42600                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42601                                  
 42602                                  WhatCPUType:
 42603                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42604                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 42605                                  
 42606                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 42607                                  
 42608                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 42609                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 42610                                  ;
 42611                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 42612                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 42613                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 42614                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 42615                                  
 42616                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42617                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 42618                                  
 42619                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 42620 00007BD3 9C                      	pushf
 42621 00007BD4 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 42622 00007BD5 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 42623                                  
 42624 00007BD7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 42625 00007BD9 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 42626 00007BDA 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 42627 00007BDB 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 42628 00007BDC 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 42629 00007BDD 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 42630 00007BE0 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 42631 00007BE3 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 42632                                  
 42633 00007BE5 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 42634 00007BE8 50                      	push	ax
 42635 00007BE9 9D                      	popf
 42636 00007BEA 9C                      	pushf
 42637 00007BEB 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 42638 00007BEC 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 42639 00007BEF 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 42640                                  
 42641                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 42642 00007BF1 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 42643                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 42644 00007BF2 43                      	inc	bx
 42645                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 42646 00007BF3 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 42647 00007BF5 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 42648 00007BF6 9D                      	popf
 42649                                  	
 42650                                  	;endm
 42651                                  
 42652                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42653                                  	;retn
 42654                                  
 42655                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42656                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 42657 00007BF7 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 42658 00007BF9 750D                    	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42659                                  					;  on 286 systems
 42660 00007BFB C706[1412][6377]        	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42661                                  
 42662 00007C01 EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done
 42663                                  
 42664                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42665 00007C03 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 42666 00007C05 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42667                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42668                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 42669                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42670                                  					; DOSINIT.
 42671                                  sr_done:
 42672 00007C08 2EC606[897B]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42673 00007C0E 1F                      	pop	ds
 42674 00007C0F CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 42675                                  
 42676                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42677                                  ;
 42678                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 42679                                  ;
 42680                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 42681                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA
 42682                                  ;
 42683                                  ; Outputs	 : Patches in AX as the segment for the following vectors:
 42684                                  ;			
 42685                                  ;			0,20-28,3a-3f
 42686                                  ;
 42687                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : DI,CX,DX,AX
 42688                                  ;
 42689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42690                                  
 42691                                  patch_vec_segments:
 42692                                  
 42693 00007C10 06                      	push	es
 42694                                  
 42695 00007C11 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0
 42696 00007C13 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 42697                                  
 42698                                  	;mov	di,82h
 42699 00007C15 BF8200                  	mov	di,INTBASE+2		; di -> segment of int 20 vector
 42700                                  
 42701 00007C18 26A30200                	mov	[es:2],ax		; segment of default divide trap handler
 42702                                  
 42703                                  					; set vectors 20 & 21
 42704                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42705                                  	;mov	cx,2
 42706                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42707                                  	;mov	cl,2
 42708                                  ps_set1:
 42709 00007C1C AB                      	stosw	; int 20h segment
 42710                                  	;add	di,2
 42711                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42712 00007C1D 47                      	inc	di
 42713 00007C1E 47                      	inc	di
 42714                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 42715                                  
 42716                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42717 00007C1F AB                      	stosw	; int 21h segment
 42718                                  	;inc	di
 42719                                  	;inc	di
 42720                                  
 42721                                  	;add	di,4			; skip int 22h vector
 42722 00007C20 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 42723                                  
 42724 00007C23 AB                      	stosw				; set int 23h
 42725 00007C24 83C706                  	add	di,6			; skip int 24h
 42726                                  
 42727                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 42728                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42729                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 42730                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42731 00007C27 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 42732                                  ps_set2:
 42733 00007C29 AB                      	stosw				
 42734                                  	;add	di,2
 42735                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42736 00007C2A 47                      	inc	di
 42737 00007C2B 47                      	inc	di
 42738 00007C2C E2FB                    	loop	ps_set2
 42739                                  
 42740 00007C2E 83C704                  	add	di,4			; skip int 29h vector (fast con) as it may
 42741                                  					;   already be set.
 42742                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42743                                  	;mov	cx,6			; set 6 segs (skip 2 between each)
 42744                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42745 00007C31 B106                    	mov	cl,6			;  set segs for ints 2ah-2fh
 42746                                  ps_set3:
 42747 00007C33 AB                      	stosw
 42748                                  	;add	di,2
 42749                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42750 00007C34 47                      	inc	di
 42751 00007C35 47                      	inc	di
 42752 00007C36 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set3
 42753                                  
 42754                                  ; 30h & 31H is the CPM call entry point whose segment address is set up by
 42755                                  ; below. So skip it.
 42756                                  
 42757 00007C38 83C708                  	add	di,8			; skip vector 30h & 31h 
 42758                                  	
 42759                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42760                                  	;mov	cx,14			; set 14 segs (skip 2 between each)
 42761                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42762 00007C3B B10E                    	mov	cl,14			;   sets segs for ints 32h-3fh
 42763                                  ps_set4:
 42764 00007C3D AB                      	stosw
 42765                                  	;add	di,2
 42766                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42767 00007C3E 47                      	inc	di
 42768 00007C3F 47                      	inc	di
 42769 00007C40 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set4
 42770                                  
 42771                                  ; set offset of int2f
 42772                                  
 42773                                  ;if installed
 42774                                  ;	mov	word ptr es:[02fh * 4],offset doscode:int2f
 42775                                  ;endif
 42776                                  	;mov	[es:0C3h],ax
 42777 00007C42 26A3C300                	mov	[es:ENTRYPOINT+3],ax
 42778                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42779                                  	; cx = 0
 42780 00007C46 07                      	pop	es
 42781 00007C47 C3                      	retn

 42784                                  ;
 42785                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_misc_segments
 42786                                  ;
 42787                                  ; Inputs	 : es = segment to patch in
 42788                                  ;		   ds = dosdata
 42789                                  ;
 42790                                  ; outputs	 : patches in the sharer and other tables in the dos

 42796                                  
 42797                                  patch_misc_segments:
 42798                                  
 42799 00007C48 53                      	push	bx
 42800 00007C49 06                      	push	es
 42801 00007C4A 50                      	push	ax
 42802                                  
 42803 00007C4B 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; ax - > DOS segment
 42804                                  	
 42805 00007C4D 1E                      	push	ds
 42806 00007C4E 07                      	pop	es			; es -> DOSDATA
 42807                                  	
 42808                                  ; initialize the jump table for the sharer...
 42809                                  
 42810                                  	;mov	di,offset dosdata:jshare
 42811                                  	;mov	di,90h
 42812 00007C4F BF[9000]                	mov	di,JShare
 42813                                  	;mov	bx,[0AAAh]
 42814 00007C52 8B1E[AA0A]              	mov	bx,[TEMP_DOSLOC]	; bx = location to which the share
 42815                                  					; table was patched during the first
 42816                                  					; call to this routine
 42817 00007C56 B90F00                  	mov	cx,15
 42818                                  jumptabloop:
 42819                                  	;add	di,2			; skip offset
 42820                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42821 00007C59 47                      	inc	di
 42822 00007C5A 47                      	inc	di
 42823 00007C5B 83FBFF                  	cmp	bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh		; Q: is this called for the 1st time
 42824 00007C5E 7405                    	je	short share_patch	; Y: patch in sharer table
 42825                                  					; N: 
 42826 00007C60 263B1D                  	cmp	bx,[es:di]		; Q: has share been installed
 42827 00007C63 7501                    	jne	short no_share_patch	; Y: don't patch in sharer table
 42828                                  share_patch:
 42829 00007C65 AB                      	stosw				; drop in segment
 42830                                  no_share_patch:
 42831 00007C66 E2F1                    	loop	jumptabloop
 42832                                  					; BUGBUG patching the country info 
 42833                                  					; with dosdata can be done inline
 42834                                  					; in dosinit.

 42836                                  					; table address

 42842                                  					; pointers with dosdata in ds
 42843                                  	;mov	[si+4Fh],ds
 42844                                  	;mov	[si+54h],ds
 42845                                  	;mov	[si+59h],ds
 42846                                  	;mov	[si+5Eh],ds
 42847                                  	;mov	[si+80h],ds
 42848                                  	;mov	[si+63h],ds
 42849 00007C6B 8C5C4F                  	mov	[si+DOS_CCDPG.ccUcase_ptr+2],ds    
 42850 00007C6E 8C5C54                  	mov	[si+DOS_CCDPG.ccFileUcase_ptr+2],ds 
 42851 00007C71 8C5C59                  	mov	[si+DOS_CCDPG.ccFileChar_ptr+2],ds

 42853 00007C77 8C9C8000                	mov	[si+DOS_CCDPG.ccMono_ptr+2],ds

 42855

 42857                                  					; so patch with doscode seg in ax
 42858

 42860                                  	;mov	si,0D30h
 42861 00007C7E BE[300D]                	mov	si,FastOpenTable

 42864                                  	; bx = [TEMP_DOSLOC]

 42870                                  					;    segment
 42871                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42873                                  	;;cmp	cx,[si+4]

 42875 00007C89 7503                    	jne	short no_fast_patch	; Y: don't patch in doscode seg
 42876                                  
 42877                                  fast_patch:

 42900                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------

 42917                                  				; set vectors 20 & 21 to point to iret.
 42918                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42920                                  
 42921                                  	;mov	cx,2		; set 2 offsets (skip 2 between each)
 42922                                  po_iset1:

 43023                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43024                                  ;
 43025                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 43026                                  ;
 43027                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 43028                                  ;
 43029                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 43030                                  ;
 43031                                  ;	Description:
 43032                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 43033                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 43034                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 43035                                  ;
 43036                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43037                                  
 43038                                  	; 04/11/2022
 43039                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43040                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 43041                                  
 43042                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 43043                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 43044                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 43045                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 43046                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 43047                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 43048                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 43049                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 43050                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 43051 00007CFD [8A10]                  	dw	i0patch
 43052 00007CFF [9410]                  	dw	i20patch
 43053 00007D01 [9E10]                  	dw	i21patch
 43054 00007D03 [A810]                  	dw	i25patch
 43055 00007D05 [B210]                  	dw	i26patch
 43056 00007D07 [BC10]                  	dw	i27patch
 43057 00007D09 [C610]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 43058 00007D0B [D010]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 43059                                  
 43060                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 43061                                  
 43062                                  patch_in_nops:
 43063 00007D0D 50                      	push	ax
 43064 00007D0E 56                      	push	si
 43065 00007D0F BE[FD7C]                	mov	si,patch_table
 43066 00007D12 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 43067                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43068                                  	; cx = 0
 43069                                  	;mov	cx,8
 43070                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 43071 00007D15 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 43072                                  pin_loop:
 43073 00007D17 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 43074 00007D1A AB                      	stosw
 43075                                  	;add	si,2
 43076                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43077 00007D1B 46                      	inc	si
 43078 00007D1C 46                      	inc	si
 43079 00007D1D E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 43080 00007D1F 5E                      	pop	si
 43081 00007D20 58                      	pop	ax
 43082 00007D21 C3                      	retn
 43083                                  
 43084                                  ; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43085                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43086                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS offset BC77h, file offset 7EA7h
 43087                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 43268                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 43269                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 43270                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 43271                                  ;;
 43272                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 43273                                  ;;
 43274                                  ;;	on return:
 43275                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 43276                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 43277                                  ;;
 43278                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 43279                                  ;;
 43280                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43281                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43282                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 43283                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 43284                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 43285                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 43286                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 43287                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 43288                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 43289                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 43290                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 43291                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 43292                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 43293                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 43294                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 43295                                  ;;
 43296                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 43504                                  ;============================================================================
 43505                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43506                                  ;============================================================================
 43507                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 43508                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 43509                                  
 43510                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 43511                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43512                                  
 43513                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 43514                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 43515                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 43516                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 43517                                  ;
 43518                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 43519                                  ; describing that data item.
 43520                                  
 43521                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43522                                  
 43523                                  ;
 43524                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 43525                                  ;
 43526                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 43527                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 43528                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 43529                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 43530                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 43531                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 43532                                  ;
 43533                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 43534                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 43535                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 43536                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 43537                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 43538                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 43539                                  ;   as EOF).
 43540                                  
 43541                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 43542                                  
 43543                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 43544                                  
 43545                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 43546 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 43547 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 43548 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 43549                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 43550 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 43551                                  
 43552                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 43553                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 43554                                  ; console.
 43555                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 43556 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 43557 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 43558                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 43559 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 43560 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 43561                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 43562 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 43563 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 43564 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 43565                                  switch_character:
 43566 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 43567 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last

 43770                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 43771                                  
 43772                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 43773                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 43774                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 43775                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 43776                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 43777                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 43778                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 43779                                  ; **********************************************************
 43780                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 43781                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 43782                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 43783                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 43784                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 43785                                  ; **********************************************************	
 43786                                  
 43787                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 43788                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43789                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43790                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 43791                                  
 43792                                  ; 	ORG     0
 43793                                  
 43794                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 43795                                  
 43796                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 43797                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 43798 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 43799 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 43800

 43802

 43806                                  RENBUF:

 43808                                  
 43809                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 43810                                  SEARCHBUF:

 43818                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 44043                                  ; patch space for Boca folks.
 44044                                  ; Say What????!!! This does NOT go into the swappable area!
 44045                                  ; NOTE: We include the decl of ibmpatch in ms-dos even though it is not needed.
 44046                                  ;       This allows the REDIRector to work on either IBM or MS-DOS.
 44047                                   
 44048                                  IBMPATCH: ; label byte
 44049                                  PRINTER_FLAG:
 44050 00000AA0 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] status of PRINT utility
 44051                                  VOLCHNG_FLAG:
 44052 00000AA1 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] true if volume label created
 44053                                  VIRTUAL_OPEN:
 44054 00000AA2 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] non-zero if we opened a virtual file
 44055                                   
 44056                                  ; Following 4 variables moved to MSDATA.asm from MSTABLE.asm (P4986)
 44057                                  
 44058                                  FSeek_drive:
 44059 00000AA3 00                      	db	0		;AN000; fastseek drive #
 44060                                  FSeek_firclus:
 44061 00000AA4 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek first cluster #
 44062                                  FSeek_logclus:
 44063 00000AA6 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek logical cluster #
 44064                                  FSeek_logsave:
 44065 00000AA8 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek returned log clus #
 44066                                  
 44067                                  ; DOSDATA:0AAAh
 44068                                  
 44069                                  TEMP_DOSLOC:
 44070 00000AAA FFFF                    	dw	-1		;stores the temporary location of dos
 44071                                  				;at SYSINIT time.
 44072                                  SWAP_END:  ; LABEL   BYTE
 44073                                   
 44074                                  ; THE FOLLOWING BYTE MUST BE HERE, IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING SWAP_END. IT CANNOT
 44075                                  ; BE USED. If the size of the swap data area is ODD, it will be rounded up
 44076                                  ; to include this byte.
 44077                                   
 44078 00000AAC 00                      	db	0
 44079

 44081

 44083

 44236                                  
 44237                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 44238                                  
 44239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44240                                  ;
 44241                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 44242                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 44243                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 44244                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 44245                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 44246                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44247                                  ; Example:
 44248                                  
 44249                                  MAP_CASE:
 44250                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 44251                                  
 44252 00000CF5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 44253 00000CF7 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 44254 00000CF9 CB                      	RETF
 44255                                  Map1:
 44256 00000CFA 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 44257 00000CFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 44258 00000CFD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 44259 00000CFE BB[AF0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 44260                                  FINISH:
 44261 00000D01 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 44262 00000D02 1F                      	POP	DS
 44263 00000D03 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 44264 00000D04 5B                      	POP	BX
 44265 00000D05 1F                      	POP	DS
 44266                                  L_RET:	
 44267 00000D06 CB                      	RETF
 44268                                  
 44269                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 44270

 44272

 44515                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 44516                                  ; 
 44517                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 44518                                  ;
 44519                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 44520                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 44521                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 44522                                  ;
 44523                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 44524                                  ;
 44525                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 44526                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 44527                                  ;
 44528                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 44529                                  ;
 44530                                  ;############################################################################
 44531                                  
 44532                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 44533                                  
 44534                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44535                                  
 44536                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44537                                  ;
 44538                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 44539                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 44540                                  ;
 44541                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 44542                                  ;
 44543                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 44544                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 44545                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 44546                                  ;
 44547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44548                                  
 44549                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 44550                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 44551                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 44552                                  ;ELSE
 44553                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 44554                                  ;ENDIF
 44555                                  ;ENDM
 44556

 44835                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44836                                  ; 04/11/2022
 44837                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44838                                  
 44839                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44840                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 44841                                  ;
 44842                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 44843                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 44844                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 44845                                  ;
 44846                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 44847                                  ;
 44848                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 44849                                  ;
 44850                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44851                                  
 44852 00001044 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 44853 0000104A 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 44854 0000104C 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 44855 00001051 CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 44856                                  
 44857                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44858                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 44859                                  ;
 44860                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 44861                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in 
 44862                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 44863                                  ;
 44864                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44865                                  
 44866 00001053 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 44867 00001058 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 44868 0000105A BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 44869                                  
 44870                                  ; DOSDATA:105Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44871                                  
 44872                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44873                                  
 44874                                  ;*** New FCB Implementation
 44875                                  ; This variable is used as a cache in the new FCB implementation to remember
 44876                                  ;the address of a local SFT that can be recycled for a regenerate operation
 44877                                  
 44878 0000105D 00000000                LocalSFT: dd	0		; 0 to indicate invalid pointer
 44879                                  
 44880                                  ;DOSDATA ENDS

 44896 00001061 90                      align 2
