 44898                                  ; DOSDATA:1062h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44899                                  
 44900                                  DOSINTTABLE:	; LABEL	DWORD
 44901                                  
 44902                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:DIVOV 		, 0
 44903                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:QUIT 		, 0
 44904                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:COMMAND		, 0
 44905                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDRD		, 0
 44906                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDWRT		, 0
 44907                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:Stay_resident	, 0
 44908                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:INT2F		, 0
 44909                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:CALL_ENTRY	, 0
 44910                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:IRETT		, 0
 44911                                  	
 44912 00001062 [4753]0000              	dw	DIVOV 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+0
 44913 00001066 [1B03]0000              	dw	QUIT 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+4	
 44914 0000106A [4703]0000              	dw	COMMAND		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+8
 44915 0000106E [7A05]0000              	dw	ABSDRD		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+12
 44916 00001072 [0106]0000              	dw	ABSDWRT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+16
 44917 00001076 [9562]0000              	dw	STAY_RESIDENT	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+20
 44918 0000107A [5007]0000              	dw	INT2F		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+24
 44919 0000107E [2203]0000              	dw	CALL_ENTRY	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+28
 44920 00001082 [2103]0000              	dw	IRETT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+32
 44921                                  
 44922 00001086 0000                    SS_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack segment
 44923 00001088 0000                    SP_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack offset
 44924                                  
 44925                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44926                                  ;
 44927                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 44928                                  ;
 44929                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 44930                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 44931                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 44932                                  ;
 44933                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 44934                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 44935                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 44936                                  ;	   4. else 
 44937                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 44938                                  ;	   6. endif
 44939                                  ;	7. else
 44940                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 44941                                  ;	9. endif
 44942                                  ;
 44943                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44944                                  
 44945                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44946                                  
 44947                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44948                                  
 44949                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44950                                  ;
 44951                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 44952                                  ;
 44953                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44954                                  
 44955                                  ldivov:
 44956                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44957                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44958                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44959                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44960                                  i0patch:
 44961 0000108A EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont	
 44962                                  
 44963 0000108C E8E000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44964                                  divov_cont:
 44965 0000108F 2EFF2E[6210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 44966                                  
 44967                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44968                                  ;
 44969                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 44970                                  ;
 44971                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 44972                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 44973                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 44974                                  ; will be restored then.
 44975                                  ;
 44976                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44977                                  
 44978                                  lquit:
 44979                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44980                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44981                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44982                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44983                                  i20patch:
 44984 00001094 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont	
 44985                                  
 44986 00001096 E8D600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44987                                  quit_cont:
 44988 00001099 2EFF2E[6610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 44989                                  
 44990                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44991                                  ;
 44992                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 44993                                  ;
 44994                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44995                                  
 44996                                  lcommand:
 44997                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44998                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44999                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45000                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45001                                  i21patch:
 45002 0000109E EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont	
 45003                                  
 45004 000010A0 E8CC00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45005                                  command_cont:
 45006 000010A3 2EFF2E[6A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 45007                                  
 45008                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45009                                  ;
 45010                                  ; INT 25 
 45011                                  ;
 45012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45013                                  
 45014                                  labsdrd:
 45015                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45016                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45017                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45018                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45019                                  i25patch:
 45020 000010A8 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont	
 45021                                  
 45022 000010AA E8C200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45023                                  absdrd_cont:
 45024 000010AD 2EFF2E[6E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 45025                                  
 45026                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45027                                  ;
 45028                                  ; INT 26
 45029                                  ;
 45030                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45031                                  
 45032                                  labsdwrt:
 45033                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45034                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45035                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45036                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45037                                  i26patch:
 45038 000010B2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont	
 45039                                  
 45040 000010B4 E8B800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45041                                  absdwrt_cont:
 45042 000010B7 2EFF2E[7210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 45043                                  
 45044                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45045                                  ;
 45046                                  ; INT 27
 45047                                  ;
 45048                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45049                                  
 45050                                  lstay_resident:
 45051                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45052                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45053                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45054                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45055                                  i27patch:
 45056 000010BC EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont	
 45057                                  
 45058 000010BE E8AE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45059                                  sr_cont:
 45060 000010C1 2EFF2E[7610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 45061                                  
 45062                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45063                                  ;
 45064                                  ; INT 2f
 45065                                  ;
 45066                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45067                                  
 45068                                  lint2f:
 45069                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45070                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45071                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45072                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45073                                  i2fpatch:
 45074 000010C6 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont	
 45075                                  
 45076 000010C8 E8A400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45077                                  int2f_cont:
 45078 000010CB 2EFF2E[7A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 45079                                  
 45080                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45081                                  ;
 45082                                  ; CPM entry
 45083                                  ;
 45084                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45085                                  
 45086                                  lcall_entry:
 45087                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45088                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45089                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45090                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45091                                  cpmpatch:
 45092 000010D0 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont	
 45093                                  
 45094 000010D2 E89A00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45095                                  callentry_cont:
 45096 000010D5 2EFF2E[7E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 45097                                  
 45098                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45099                                  
 45100                                  lirett:
 45101 000010DA CF                      	iret
 45102                                  
 45103                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45104                                  ;
 45105                                  ; LowIntXX:
 45106                                  ;
 45107                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 45108                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 45109                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 45110                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 45111                                  ;
 45112                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 45113                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 45114                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 45115                                  ;
 45116                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 45117                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 45118                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 45119                                  ;
 45120                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45121                                  
 45122 000010DB 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 45123 000010DF 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 45124 000010E3 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 45125                                  
 45126                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 45127                                  LowInt23:
 45128                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45129                                  					; the stack
 45130 000010E7 2E8F06[DB10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 45131 000010EC 2E8F06[DD10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 45132                                  
 45133 000010F1 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 45134                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45135                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45136                                  
 45137 000010F3 E87900                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 45138                                  
 45139 000010F6 2EFF2E[DB10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 45140                                  
 45141                                  
 45142                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 45143                                  LowInt24:
 45144                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45145                                  					; the stack
 45146 000010FB 2E8F06[DF10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 45147 00001100 2E8F06[E110]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 45148                                  
 45149 00001105 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 45150                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45151                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45152                                  
 45153 00001107 E86500                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45154                                  
 45155 0000110A 2EFF2E[DF10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 45156                                  
 45157                                  
 45158                                   
 45159                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 45160                                  LowInt28:
 45161 0000110F CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 45162                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45163                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45164                                  
 45165 00001111 E85B00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45166                                  
 45167 00001114 CB                      	retf
 45168                                  
 45169                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45170                                  
 45171                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45172                                  ;
 45173                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 45174                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 45175                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 45176                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 45177                                  ;
 45178                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45179                                  
 45180                                  disa20_xfer:
 45181 00001115 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 45182                                  
 45183                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 45184                                  
 45185                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 45186                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 45187                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 45188                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 45189                                  
 45190 00001118 FA                      	cli
 45191 00001119 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 45192                                  
 45193 0000111F 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 45194 00001121 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 45195 00001123 FB                      	sti
 45196                                  
 45197 00001124 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 45198 00001125 56                      	push	SI
 45199 00001126 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 45200 00001128 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 45201 0000112A 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 45202 0000112C CB                      	retf
 45203                                  
 45204                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45205                                  ;
 45206                                  ; M003:
 45207                                  ;
 45208                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 45209                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 45210                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 45211                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 45212                                  ; more info.	
 45213                                  ;
 45214                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 45215                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 45216                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 45217                                  ;
 45218                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45219                                  
 45220                                  disa20_iret:
 45221 0000112D E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 45222 00001130 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 45223 00001134 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 45224 00001138 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 45225 0000113C 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 45226                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 45227 0000113E 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 45228 00001141 A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 45229 00001144 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 45230 00001147 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 45231 0000114A A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 45232                                  
 45233 0000114D 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 45234 0000114E 5B                      	pop	BX
 45235 0000114F 59                      	pop	CX
 45236 00001150 5A                      	pop	DX
 45237 00001151 5E                      	pop	SI
 45238 00001152 5F                      	pop	DI
 45239 00001153 5D                      	pop	BP
 45240 00001154 1F                      	pop	DS
 45241 00001155 07                      	pop	ES
 45242 00001156 CF                      	iret
 45243                                  
 45244                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45245                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 45246                                  ;									      
 45247                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 45248                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45249                                  ;									      
 45250                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 45251                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 45252                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 45253                                  ;									      
 45254                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45255                                  
 45256                                  XMMDisableA20:
 45257 00001157 53                      	push	bx
 45258 00001158 50                      	push	ax
 45259                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 45260 00001159 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 45261 0000115B 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45262 00001160 58                      	pop	ax
 45263 00001161 5B                      	pop	bx
 45264 00001162 C3                      	retn
 45265                                  
 45266                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 45267                                  
 45268                                  XMMcontrol:
 45269 00001163 00000000                	dd	0
 45270                                  
 45271                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45272                                  ;
 45273                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 45274                                  ;									      
 45275                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 45276                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45277                                  ;									      
 45278                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 45279                                  ;
 45280                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 45281                                  ;		
 45282                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 45283                                  ;									      
 45284                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45285                                  
 45286                                  LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 45287 00001167 8000                    	dw	00080h
 45288 00001169 0000                    	dw	00000h
 45289                                  
 45290                                  HighMemory:	; label dword
 45291 0000116B 9000                    	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 45292 0000116D FFFF                    	dw	0FFFFh
 45293                                  
 45294                                  EnsureA20ON:
 45295 0000116F 9C                      	pushf
 45296 00001170 1E                      	push    ds
 45297 00001171 06                      	push	es
 45298 00001172 51                      	push	cx
 45299 00001173 56                      	push	si
 45300 00001174 57                      	push	di
 45301                                  
 45302 00001175 2EC536[6711]            	lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 45303 0000117A 2EC43E[6B11]            	les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 45304 0000117F B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 45305 00001182 FC                      	cld
 45306 00001183 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 45307                                  
 45308 00001185 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 45309                                  EA20_RET:
 45310 00001187 5F                      	pop	di
 45311 00001188 5E                      	pop	si
 45312 00001189 59                      	pop	cx
 45313 0000118A 07                      	pop	es
 45314 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds
 45315 0000118C 9D                      	popf
 45316 0000118D C3                      	retn
 45317                                  
 45318                                  EA20_OFF:
 45319                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 45320                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 45321                                  
 45322 0000118E 53                      	push	bx
 45323 0000118F 50                      	push	ax
 45324                                  
 45325 00001190 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 45326 00001192 2EA3[8610]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 45327 00001196 2E8926[8810]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 45328 0000119B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 45329 0000119D 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45330 0000119F BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 45331                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 45332                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 45333 000011A2 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 45334 000011A4 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45335 000011A9 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 45336 000011AB 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 45337                                  
 45338 000011AD 2EA1[8610]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 45339 000011B1 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45340 000011B3 2E8B26[8810]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 45341                                  
 45342 000011B8 58                      	pop	ax
 45343 000011B9 5B                      	pop	bx
 45344                                  
 45345 000011BA EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 45346                                  
 45347                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 45348 000011BC B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 45349 000011BE CD10                    	int	10h
 45350 000011C0 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 45351 000011C2 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 45352 000011C4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 45353 000011C6 B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 45354 000011C8 CD10                    	int	10h
 45355                                  XMMcont:
 45356 000011CA B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 45357 000011CC 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 45358 000011CE CD10                    	int	10h
 45359                                  	
 45360 000011D0 BE[B812]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 45361 000011D3 0E                      	push	cs
 45362 000011D4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45363 000011D5 FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 45364                                  XMMprnt:
 45365 000011D6 AC                      	lodsb
 45366 000011D7 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 45367 000011D9 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 45368 000011DB B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 45369 000011DD BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 45370 000011E0 CD10                    	int	10h
 45371 000011E2 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 45372                                  
 45373                                  XMMStall:
 45374 000011E4 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 45375 000011E5 EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 45376                                  
 45377                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45378                                  
 45379                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45380                                  
 45381                                  ; retrodos4.s ; offset 0Ch in BIOS segment (0070h)
 45382                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 45383                                  
 45384                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 45385                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 45386                                  
 45387                                  OldInstanceJunk:
 45388 000011E7 7000                    	dw	70h	;segment of BIOS
 45389 000011E9 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 45390 000011EB 0600                    	dw	6	;5 instance items
 45391                                  
 45392                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:contpos, 2
 45393                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:bcon, 4
 45394                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:carpos,106h
 45395                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:charco, 1
 45396                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:exec_init_sp, 34               ;M032
 45397                                  	;dw	070h,offset BData:altah, 1	 ; altah byte in bios
 45398                                  
 45399 000011ED 0000[2200]0200          	dw	0,CONTPOS,2
 45400 000011F3 0000[3200]0400          	dw	0,BCON,4
 45401 000011F9 0000[F901]0601          	dw	0,CARPOS,106h
 45402 000011FF 0000[0003]0100          	dw	0,CHARCO,1
 45403 00001205 0000[C00F]2200          	dw	0,exec_init_SP,34
 45404 0000120B 70000C000100            	dw	70h,ALTAH,1	; altah byte in bios
 45405

 45407                                  
 45408                                  ; M021-
 45409                                  ;
 45410                                  ; DosHasHMA - This flag is set by seg_reinit when the DOS actually
 45411                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable
 45412                                  ;	indicator that the DOS is actually using HMA. You can't just use
 45413                                  ;	CS, because ROMDOS uses HMA with CS < F000.
 45414                                  
 45415                                  DosHasHMA:
 45416 00001211 00                      	db	0
 45417                                  FixExePatch:
 45418 00001212 0000                    	dw	0		; M012
 45419                                  RationalPatchPtr:
 45420 00001214 0000                    	dw	0		; M012
 45421                                  
 45422                                  ; End M021

 45429 00001216 51                      	push	cx
 45430 00001217 8B0E1000                	mov	cx,[10h]
 45431                                  rbc_loop:
 45432                                  	;loop	$
 45433 0000121B E2FE                    	loop	rbc_loop
 45434 0000121D 59                      	pop	cx
 45435 0000121E CB                      	retf

 45456                                  ;
 45457                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 45458                                  ;
 45459                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 45460                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 45461                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 45462                                  ;
 45463                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 45464                                  ;
 45465                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 45466                                  ;
 45467                                  ;############################################################################
 45468                                   
 45469                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 45470                                  
 45471                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45472                                  
 45473                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 45474                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 45475                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 45476                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 45477                                  
 45478                                  ; country and code page information
 45479                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45480                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 45481 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 45482 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 45482 0000123B 53595300           
 45483                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 45484 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 45485                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45486                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45487                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 45488                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 45489                                  ;  endif
 45490                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 45491                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 45492                                  ;  endif
 45493                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 45494                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 45495                                  ;  endif
 45496                                  ;else
 45497 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 45498                                  ;endif
 45499                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45500 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 45501 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 45502 00001277 [AD0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 45503 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45504 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 45505 0000127C [2F0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 45506 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45507 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 45508 00001281 [B10B]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 45509 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45510 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 45511 00001286 [E10B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 45512 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45513 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 45514 0000128B [E30C]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 45515 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 45516 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 45517 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 45518                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45519                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45520                                  ;	...... 
 45521                                  ;else
 45522 00001292 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 45523 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 45524 00001296 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 45525 00001298 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 45526 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 45527 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 45528 000012A1 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 45529 000012A3 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 45530 000012A5 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 45531 000012A6 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 45532 000012A7 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 45533 000012A8 [F50C]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 45534 000012AA 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 45535 000012AC 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator
 45536 000012AE 000000000000000000-     	dw   0,0,0,0,0			; reserved
 45536 000012B7 00                 
 45537                                  ;endif

 45591                                  ;

 45605 000012E7 2902E8                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h

 45631                                  
 45632                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 45633                                  ;
 45634                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 45635                                  ;

 45637                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds

 45676                                  
 45677                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 45678                                  
 45679                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 45680                                  ;
 45681                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 45682                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 45683                                  ;
 45684                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 45685                                  ;
 45686                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 45687                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 45688                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45689                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 45690                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 45691                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 45692                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 45693                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 45694                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 45695                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 45696                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 45697                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 45698                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 45699                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 45700                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 45701                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45702                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 45703                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45704                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 45705                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45706                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 45707                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 45708                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45709                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 45710                                  ;
 45711                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 45712                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 45713                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 45714                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 45715                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 45716                                  ;
 45717                                  ;   CRDROK:
 45718                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 45719                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45720                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 45721                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 45722                                  
 45723 00001314 061F                    DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 45724                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 45725 00001316 8BDF                    DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 45726                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 45727 00001318 33C08BD0E8              			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 45728                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 45729 0000131D DF0E                    			db	0DFH,00EH
 45730                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 45731 0000131F 1E36C5363605E8AF0E      			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 45732 00001328 8BD7B486368B3E          			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 45733                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 45734 0000132F 0903                    			db	009H,003H
 45735 00001331 F7C700807419E84717      			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 45736 0000133A 8BFA0AC074103C0374-     			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 45736 00001343 03                 
 45737 00001344 1FEBCF                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH

 45742

 45745                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 45746                                  
 45747                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 45748                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 45749                                  ;
 45750                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 45751                                  ;
 45752                                  ;

 45754                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 45755                                  ;	    je l1
 45756                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 45757                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 45758                                  ;	    int 10h
 45759                                  ;	    jmp l0
 45760                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 45761                                  
 45762 00001353 AC                      DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 45763 00001354 3C24                    		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 45764 00001356 7408                    		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 45765 00001358 B307                    		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 45766 0000135A B40E                    		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 45767 0000135C CD10                    		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 45768 0000135E EBF3                    		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 45769 00001360 EBFE                    		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 45770                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 45787                                  ;============================================================================
 45788                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 45789                                  ;============================================================================
 45790                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 45791                                  
 45792                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 45793                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 45794                                  ;
 45795                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 45796                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 45797                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 45798                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 45799                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 45800                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 45801                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 45802                                  ; to call out here.
 45803                                  ;
 45804                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 45805                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 45806                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 45807                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 45808                                  ;       
 45809                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 45810                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 45811                                  ;
 45812                                  ;Exported Functions
 45813                                  ;==================
 45814                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 45815                                  
 45816                                  ; DosData Segment
 45817                                  
 45818                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45819                                  
 45820                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45821                                  
 45822                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 45823                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 45824                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 45825                                  ; 'patch' related.
 45826                                  
 45827                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 45828                                  	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 45829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45830                                  
 45831                                  MagicPatch:
 45832                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 45833                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 45834                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 45835                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 45836                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 45837                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 45838                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 45839                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 45840                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 45841                                  
 45842                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45843                                  
 45844                                  ;DosData Ends
 45845                                  
 45846                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 45847                                  
 45848                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45849                                  
 45850                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 45851                                  
 45852                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45853                                  
 45854                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45855                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 45856                                  
 45857                                  db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 45858                                  
 45859                                  ;align 16
 45860                                  
 45861                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 45862                                  
 45863                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45865                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
